Reviews.Content: Friendly , convient, close to everything. resturant on site, little noisy, take your ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “FLY ME TO THE MOON”
Reviews.Author: MARCO_POLO_9
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay at Hotel Cielo and once again I had a great time, this time I invited my family to join me from Lancaster PA, we booked 5 rooms and they were all really nice rooms, some with a balcony and ocean views, my niece was celebrating her 18th Birthday and the owner or manager named Steve threw her a beautiful birthday party on the rooftop garden with live music, Steve didn't ask for any money and said he was happy to have us for the 1 week we had booked, it must have been the Full Moon, he also gave us some great places to eat besides the hotels excellent restaurant, for me it's the Pancakes and Bacon in the morning, I highly recommend this hotel, I also suggest you check out the rooftop garden with the most unbelievable view of the crystal blue sea, great place for a wedding if your looking to tie the knot, for me it's about to be untied, will be back next year with my new girlfriend, keep up the great job and thanks again to Steve for the Birthday Party,

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sirena3
Reviews.Content: Our third trip to Playa was even better than the last one!! This time we brought six other friends with us and we all had a blast. The hotel is right near the center of town but not too close to the music venues, which is great when you are trying to sleep! Our rooms were clean and the beds were made in a timely fashion every day. The front desk staff were attentive and reliable, giving us timely excursion prices and setting up airport transport quickly and efficiently. The restaurant kicked it up a notch from the last time we were here... We had a delicious breakfast every morning ( I recommend the huevos rancheros and fresh OJ), and we all seemed to gravitate back for the happy hour every night (awesome margaritas and awesome salsas and chips). We highly recommend the restaurant/club Fusion for lunch and as a mellow beach hang out. For diving, the front desk has a great recommendation. We saw turtles, eels and some beautiful fish. For snorkeling, take a collective taxi to Akumaal. It was really great.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and stole my deposit!”
Reviews.Author: ajbam
Reviews.Content: The cielo staff screwed up and did not give us our $20 towel deposit that they owed us. Additionally, they held us hostage to it and we almost missed our bus in the morning hours. All this for $20. DONT stay at this hotel. You will get robbed. POOR service. It was such a pain. We have finally had to dispute charges on the credit card. Pay with your card so they cannot scam you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with sweet roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: evilmosquito
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Cielo on two separate occasions on our recent 10 night stay in the Yucatan. We did not make reservations in advance of arriving in Playa Del Carmen and after touring a few hotels around the area we selected Cielo. We stayed there for nights 2 and 3 of our trip before we moved on to our next town in our Mexican Tour. The hotel is very clean, has a pleasant staff and an amazing view of 5th Ave from their roof terrace. Additionally, on the last night of our trip, we were staying in nearby hotel which we had to leave at midnight after waking up to an ant problem. We left that hotel and walked over to Cielo at midnight, they had rooms available and we stayed there for the last night of our trip. We stayed in two seperate rooms in the hotel and both were very nice. The only criticism I can think of about this hotel is noise from the hallway can be heard in the rooms so we were woken up in the morning by children playing and people walking around outside.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: vivomexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week, I booked it because of all the good reviews on this sight. What a disappointment. We made reservations in the fall and requested a refrigerator in our room. The reply was that they would do their best. We booked for 2 weeks and checked out after 4 days. The day time staff in both the hotel and restaurant were generally good ( Ana banana in the restaurant was fabulous.Roberto at the front desk was pleasant and the maids did a good job at keeping things clean.However the evening staff at the front desk (Andrea) and the night staff at the restaurant need to take some courses in customer relations. Andrea was so busy reading facebook or whatever that she responded very negatively to any request. No we don.t have extra pillows we are almost full, no other guests are using the refrigerator, no we don't have a key for the safe in that room etc. The head waiter in the restaurant at night was arrogant and rude and the food was nothing to write home about. The continental breakfast was a choice between some kind of egg dish or oatmeal. Gee I always thought that fruit & yogurt was inexpensive or cereal, colesteral city. Our room was like being in a fishbowl, a glass insert in the door, lots of windows with curtains not big enough to cover the entire window. I changed my clothes in the very small bathroom. The hot water in the bathroom sink did not work. I discovered that the valve was shut off and when I turned it on the tap dripped at a steady rate. So fix it already. Three pieces of furniture; 1 night table. bed & TV. no luggage rack, a monks cell is probably better furnished. I think that it is overpriced for what I would say was a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super value, friendliest service anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: Kjan77
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a lovely, one week stay at the Cielo, right off the Avenida in Playa del Carmen. We paid an astonishingly low price for high season and a location right off the Avenida and one short block to the gorgeous beach. Miguel, Andrea and the other folks who work at the hotel and adjacent Carboncitas restaurant could not have been nicer. Such genuine, warm-hearted folks. Yes, the beds were a bit hard (but I got used to them after the first night), and the hot water and water pressure may leave something to be desired, but for the price, I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. Just don't go expecting a 5-star hotel at these prices, and you will be very pleasantly surprised. We were directed to very inexpensive modes of transport around the area, from the ADO bus directly from Cancun Airport to within 2 blocks of the hotel for $21/pp RT, to the collectivos that took us to Akumal (gorgeous snorkeling beach about 40 km away) for $5/pp RT. At night, the Avenida is right there with shopping, dining and entertainment at your doorstep. We felt very safe and secure here at all times. I highly recommend the Cielo.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great restaurant, but a little noisy at night.”
Reviews.Author: MNfoodiegirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cielo is located right off of 5th avenue, which can be good or bad. You are close to all the action, but it is very noisy at night. The restaurant across from the hotel plays very loud mariachi music some nights until 12:00. Make sure to bring ear plugs. Our room was very clean, but minimal. It did not have a dresser or even a chair, which would have been nice. The best thing about the hotel is the people who work there and the restaurant. Great food for excellent prices. Very authentic. All of their tacos were excellent and well as items from the grill. The pumpkin seed salsa is also great. Good happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: DoubleD004
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 8 days at Hotel Cielo in Playa Del Carmen beginning December 5, 2010. We upgraded to the balcony room with a king size bed and housekeeping kept the room very clean and changed the bedding daily. Plenty of hot shower water and they even provided a small refrigerator at no extra cost. The hotel staff was always available and very helpful with our numerous questions or requests. Russell the owner was also very nice and helpful. Breakfasts were included at the resturant Carboncitos next door and were fantastic. Their french toast is delicious and service very good. The chips, salsa platter were great. Hotel Cielo's location is superb with 5th Ave just around the corner, the bus terminal close by to travel to Tulum, Akumal, and Cancun Airport. The Playa beach is only a block away from the hotel. Our daughter and boy friend also stayed at Cielo but in another room and were equally impressed with location, cleanliness, and value. They are planning another trip to Hotel Cielo in March. My wife and I are both retired and hope to return to Hotel Cielo again soon. We certainly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Cielo have recommended it our friends and relatives. Madison, Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Cielo definitely aided in our relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: Mizzy406
Reviews.Content: Arriving tired and full of angst related to my "real life," I was a first complaining about not being able to flush the toilet paper and the A/C wasn't on and/or it was cold at night and there weren't any washcloths and it took 20 minutes to get hot water, etc., etc. and I was not at all happy. By day two we had washcloths (all we had to do was ask and housekeeping apologized profusely for the oversight). By day two we had figured out the plumbing and learned the 'trick' to on-demand hot water and why we couldn't flush paper (it's not the hotel, it's just Mexico in general). By day two I was... relaxed! That's all it took.... Less than 24-hours and I had thrown away my U.S. angst and irritations and was fully-immersed into the Mexican way of life.... Slow and easy. The hotel staff were all wonderful - Andrea was our favorite as she was always so pleasant and happy and helpful and energetic. Miguel and Roberto were also very friendly and took care of all of our needs and answered all of our questions. The Carboncito's staff, especially Anna, took such good care of us that we felt like we were family. Russell, the owner, made sure we were on-track and "in-the-know" with regard to what to do and how to get to where we were going. Yes, in less than 24-hours I went from disgruntled and "are you kidding me?!" to "I love this charming hotel and I love Mexico and I never want to go home." The rooms are basic but clean and an excellent value... So much more authentic and comfortable than high-priced, cookie-cutter resort rooms that are miles from the action of 5th Ave. You just can't get better than Hotel Cielo with regard to location, price, staff, etc., etc. Upon leaving, our ONLY "complaint" (if you can call it that) is that there really should be some lounge chairs on the rooftop. There really isn't a common area like a lobby where guests can sit and relax except for the rooftop, and there are no comfy chairs up there... Which is a shame because it's such a nice view. I would definitely stay at Hotel Cielo again. And again and again and again. :)

Reviews.Title: “King bedroom with balcony..that's the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: WIBS
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little hotel..we loved it! We hope to return November 2011. Cleanliness...Spotless! Services...Andrea, Roberto, Miguel, Zenaida, Carla, Jerry...the staff are AMAZING! Our gratitude to everyone we met! GRACIAS! Location...Great! Steps away from 5th av and you can cross over 5th to head seconds to the beach. Value...There were 2 different plans to pick from. One is the regular price for a room per night and the other was the room per night plus the optional plan (included breakfast for 2 people and a few other things like a beach club something or other..my apologies..I clearly didn't take this plan as I stayed solo and went with option one.) Rooms...King bedroom with balcony..loved it...only one drawback, you can stay up way too late watching all the activity on the streets! :-) My room had a lovely balcony overlooking calle 4. There's a smallish bathroom with a toilet, shower and a window. Your sink is in your bedroom area not the bathroom. There's a little dressing area (of sorts) that has a bookcase for your clothes and a safe. At the end of your bed, against the wall, is a bench. It's nice a spacious and super clean! And..it has a t.v. if you want one..I don't watch t.v. on vacation. Sleep quality..A nice king size bed with lots of pillows. There's also a roof terrace with nice views!

Reviews.Title: “Once Again We Loved Our Stay At Hotel Cielo”
Reviews.Author: cigarman25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Cielo two years ago and absolutely loved it. When we were planning our trip for October we researched other hotels but figured why try somewhere else when we really liked Cielo the last time. Well let me tell you. Our stay this time was even better. James and Russell and all the staff were very attentive and genuinely interested in making sure we had a good stay. Not only at the hotel but on daily excursions. We don't like the tourist trap areas (i.e. Xcarat and the other theme parks) so they steered us in the right direction and we had a great time. If your into the local flavor and want to be treated right then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Mugatu77
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cielo exceeded my every expectation during my stay in Playa del Carmen. The location is absolutely perfect, only a block from the beach with beautiful views available from the balconies. The rooms are quaint,beautifully decorated and very comfortable. There is space on the roof for parties, private dinners, or if you just want to enjoy the view of Cozumel sparkling in the distance. The staff are friendly and courteous and will do anything to make your stay comfortable and worry free. The prices are amazing for such a wonderful hotel in the middle of the action. I cannot wait to stay at Hotel Cielo again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the hotel with the true flavor of Mexico”
Reviews.Author: DonnaWaukegan
Reviews.Content: I loved the decor of this hotel, and the balcony overlooking the streets where so much was happening was so fun!!The staff was simply amazing....very helpful,and willing to do whatever they could.I felt completely safe and secure here.We dined quite a bit at Carboncitos, attached to Hotel Cielo, as the food was wonderful and very nicely priced, again with a staff that was all they could be.I look forward to my next visit to Playa, and staying once again at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home”
Reviews.Author: Magickfeet
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and our 18 year old daughter. We loved our time at the beautiful little Hotel Cielo. Our room was clean and bright and comfortable. The staff were genuinely kind, bright people, all of whom we thoroughly enjoyed talking and laughing with. They were very helpful in every way, and offered great insight into what to do and where to go for fun and exploration. The restaurant provided a great, yummy breakfast and coffee every morning, and the food was so good we had several lunches and dinners there as well! The location was perfect, central to everything and very close to the beach. We just loved it so much. We did not want the resort experience, but rather a smaller, more personal setting which is exactly what we got! My family will definitely return to Hotel Cielo.

Reviews.Title: “tranquilo.....”
Reviews.Author: mrsr05
Reviews.Content: the staff, the rooms, the accommodations,the cost, the proximity to 5th, the proximity to the beach, the complimentary breakfast at carboncitos (YUMMY) all wonderful.. will absolutely return... wouldnt change a thing!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cielo cares about the people who stay there.”
Reviews.Author: abicus07
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay in Hotel Cielo. First of all, the location is fantastic. It is very close to the bus that goes to the Cancun Airport. Also, the hotel is located in the midst of all the 'action' in Playa del Carmen and many places in Playa are within walking distance. The restaurant, Carbonocitos, next door is phenomenal and you get a discount on their food for staying at the hotel. The rooms are very inexpensive. The boost for me was that when I got sick the staff took care of me like I was part of the family. They arranged a doctor to come see me, they brought me chicken noodle soup to my room, and they brought me my medicine. It was really comforting to know that even while in a foreign country I could be looked after in such an above-and-beyond way. I definitely recommend Hotel Cielo and will stay there again when I visit Playa del Carmen again.

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN GEM!- 30 steps to the beach, best mexican food in Playa”
Reviews.Author: discodollydiva
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT! The food at the restaurant below- the hotel is the best in playa for taste, quality and in price (plus you get a 10% discount on lunch and dinner) My fiance and I originally booked for 4 nights at this hotel, and we loved it so much we stayed 4 more days! The hotel is 5 steps to 5th street and 30 steps to the beach. We stayed in two rooms on the property both were really nice, clean, and comfortable and the AC's work excellent. The rooms are the best bargain in Playa. Cable TV and Free wireless internet and free breakfast of your choice (french toast, huevos rancheros etc etc.. ) are included. The staff is really friendly-especially the morning cook. If you are looking for a great budget holiday STAY HERE! The location can't be beat- you are steps from multiple dive shops, car rental, mexican souvenier stands, beach, and if you wanted 10 minutes walk from the Walmart. We never took one taxi while here. This hotel is fantastic, the other reviews were correct in reccomending this cute hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base to enjoy Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: birchmark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Cielo in May of 2010. Online it looked like a quaint boutique hotel right in the middle of the action in Playa del Carmen. That is just what we found. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the breakfast that was included with our stay was excellent. The location added to the good experience. We were just a half block off the strip and a block and a half from the beach. Easy access to everything at a economical price that allowed us (on a budget) to take advantage of great restaurants, tours, etc. The beach itself is well worth the trip. I recommend this hotel to those who are not looking for the sterilized and Americanized resort, but instead want an authentic, but clean, safe and affordable location.

Reviews.Title: “Shock and Awe!”
Reviews.Author: NY_Candygram
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Cielo to spend 3 nights after having spent 5 rain-soaked days on Isla Mujeres. Upon check-in, Andrea promised that our fortunes were about to change. That was the first understatement of our stay. Although we had researched the hotel quite exhaustively prior to choosing it, we weren't prepared for the reality that is Cielo - images on the internet, stunning as they are, do not do this place justice. Upon entering our room, we were blown away by the sheer beauty of our surroundings. It was like being in a Spanish hacienda from the pages of National Geographic. Real wood windows that opened, double wooden french doors that opened to the balcony that was furnished with comfy chairs and flowering plants. Below our room was the rightfully-acclaimed Carboncito's, whose friendly staff was eager to satisfy our hunger, and quench our thirst. We learned the hard way that the stores in Playa are prohibited from selling wine and liquor after a certain hour on Sunday. Not so with restaurants, as Adrian guided us to a wonderful bottle of chardonnay which spent the evening with us on our balcony. All of the staff was eager to help us with the dozens of questions we asked, and constantly inquired as to our well-being. We even got to meet the hotelier-extraordinaire Russell, who graciously interrupted his own dinner to greet us. It spoke volumes for the character of management when the staff recounted events that occurred last year at this time, during the height of the Swine Flu scare. As many hotels and restaurants were laying off employees, or closing altogether, the principals of Cielo/Carboncito's retained the entire staff, dipping into personal savings in order to do so. In previous trips to the Riviera Maya, we've almost always stayed at all-inclusives. After beings guests of Hotel Cielo, it's doubtful that we will ever stay anywhere else. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! We will see you again Henry!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deezlr8
Reviews.Content: Travelling south from Cancun to Playa Del Carmen we were always looking forward to arriving at Hotel Cielo and after the cab dropped us off at the end of 5th Avenue, we took a long stroll with our packs through the shops, restaurants and tourist vendors until we made it! Smack bang in the middle of PDC, Cielo's location is perfect for everything you could want in Playa - 1minute walk to beach, 20 second walk to bars,retaurants and shops, you couldn't want to be anywhere else when visiting this beach side town. Our room was on the first floor with a balcony overlooking the street and reception desk, a big comfy bed, tele, hot shower and we couldn't have been more comfortable. The sounds of the restaurants around start to quieten down after midnight so getting sleep is no problem at all! Then do it all over again bright and early in the morning! The restaurant next door is nice, as well as the guys over the road at Agua(?), I forget the waiters name but I really want to find a place that sells that little pyramid trick he got us with, great food and beers served ontop of waiters heads adds to the fun (and the tab!) Hotel Cielo was absoutely brilliant and situated in the heart of Playa, thanks again to Henry for booking us in this time and when we make it back to Mexico we will be staying at Cielo once again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cielo was our home away from home without the stress.”
Reviews.Author: Leweezel
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, til the moment we left, our stay at Hotel Cielo was nothing but a delight. The staff is extremely friendly and will help you with all your vacationing needs. We can't wait to return to this beautiful, centrally located, steps from the beach, secluded but in the middle of the action, perfect vacation get away. Hotel Cielo, thankyou for making our vacation the best ever! MUCHAS GRACIAS!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Cozy, Clean, Cool, Close to everything and 1 block from white sand beaches...”
Reviews.Author: livelarggg
Reviews.Content: What are you waiting for? Book a flight the hotel is here!!... I have been returning consistently to this area south of Cancun for years. This hotel is cool and the management is cool and the rooms are secure. This staff makes vacations possible. The hotel doesnt look like much from the outside but is very traditional/warm and offers all the things I need at home and on vacation. In-house restaurant bar/cantina Carboncitos(very good), air conditioning, key entry safe, cable tv, wi-fi, and drinking water. For about 8 dollars I catch an ADO bus from cancun airport to Playa about two or three blocks from Cielo- roll the luggage right to the door. The food is good and the beer is cold and the weather is warm- 1 block from white sand beaches. And minutes from cantinas like fusion, zenzi, deep blue, and dont forget pirata for ceviche and nachos ... A 5 min walk to catch the ferry to cozumel and or a collectivo(van) for $ 3.50 to akumal or tulum. All things considered and for the price this hotel makes it possible for multiple trips throughout the year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay-Best Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: cudabob
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in Feb 2010 and had a great time. Room #11 was clean, large, 2 balconies, ocean views. Staff very helpful and friendly, especially Henry (Manager), Andrea and Ana (in the restaurant). All spoke very good english and gave good directions. No problems whatsoever with the accomodations. One block from a beautiful, swimmable beach; right in the middle of 5th ave. Attached restaurant (Carboncitos) was fantastic, especially mojitos, pumpkin seed salsa and tacos el pastor. Very reasonable prices for food. Owner, Russell, there most days, make sure and say HI. We know where we're heading in Playa next year! Thanks Henry.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, Perfect location, Perfect price”
Reviews.Author: FRANZESE
Reviews.Content: This trip was a culmination of all the "side trips" we've taken around Playa Del Carmen which ended at Hotel Cielo. I wouldnt have it any other way. Beautiful, clean, bright and comfortable. Henery (and everyone else) was friendly and helpful but never were intu rusive and let us enjoy peace and quiet. Carboncitos, the eatery downstairs was tasty with excellent service. Fun location with charm of its own. You wont forget this place any time soon. Thanks Henery, see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sambushtown
Reviews.Content: I don't know who has been writing these reviews but they must have stayed in a different hotel!!! I booked Hotel Cielo after I read all of the positive reviews. When we arrived everything went pretty smoothly until we got up to our room. The room wasn't too bad, seemed pretty clean. We did notice a huge air conditioning unit on the rooftop that blocked our view to the ocean but we thought no big deal because we wouldn't be in the room often anyway. Also noticed an opening in the bathroom so you really didn't have any privacy. (Good thing we were a couple who could laugh about it). First night we crashed out and woke up early to a strange smell. Wow, it smells like sewage in the bathroom!!! We even thought maybe you have to keep the toilet down. Went to the front desk and was told we can change to a balcony room on our fourth day. By the second night the room smelled like holy hell and the air conditioner started rattling very loudly at aroung 3am. I went to the front desk around 530 and demanded another room. We were given another room and was told oh yeah, I have to fix the bathroom. And we even given the old line, air conditioner was loud but you slept there last night!!! Does it matter? It's at the crack of dawn and I got absolutely no rest. We did get another room, well more like a fishbowl with windows to the stairs and balcony. We could hear every single conversation from the front desk and the kitchen staff. Even got to hear a guy singing first thing in the morning as he painted the balcony. The two rooms we stayed in were absolutely horrible and they shouldn't book those rooms for full price. They should be ashamed of themselves!! We checked out and went to Hotel Luna where the room was fantastic and service was flawless!! On a positive note, the woman who works at the front desk was very sweet and gave wonderful service. Wished we could have dealt with her instead of the others, experience may have been completely different.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen, a wonderland very beatiful paradise by the sea love it all my vacation will include Playa.”
Reviews.Author: rasrichie
Reviews.Content: I met and found a new friend Henry from hotel Cielo in Playa Del Carmen who was very helpful that guy goes above and beyond for the customers, I witness it as a visitor I needed some assistance for a ticket to another place and he led me to a ticket agency MAYALUUM where Claudia assisted me just a nice set of people down there, small family oriented community with all the restaurants, seafood you can eat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelManiacX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cielo for 5 nights during our trip to Mexico last week. We loved everything about it. We first got room #2 on the ground floor for a very cheap rate. This room is beautiful, we loved the arch design, it was cheap only because the window is small and doesn't let in a lot of sunlight. The only problem was that the cold water tap wasn't working so the next day we got a free upgrade to room #13 on the second floor. Something the hotel should consider changing is the internet. Free wireless is available but it was extremely slow, kept disconnecting and reconnecting, so it wasn't very useful. Henry was very helpful, always happy to assist us and give us advice about anything we asked, including excursions and local places to eat. The staff in both the hotel and the hotel's restaurant were wonderful, always helpful with a smile! We had breakfast at the restaurant everyday, and we loved it - especially the mexican eggs and ranchero eggs were delicious! We have no complaints about this hotel. It is a wonderful simple hotel, in excellent location (1 block to the beach). Highly recommended to anyone! we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, charming... perfect for us!!”
Reviews.Author: mz72
Reviews.Content: What a great little gem of a hotel! So quaint and charming... exactly what we were looking for! Great location! 1 block to the beach - You could see the beach from our hotel balcony. Perfect proximity to restaurants, shopping, nightlife, beach. The food was great - beer was cheap, only $2 for a Sol! Of course, Henry was a fantastic concierge. Always willing to answer questions, give recommendations or just chit-chat with us and the kids! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely be back...hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “My little piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Squeaker1969
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 5 times- my goal is to try every room-each is a little different. Like the authentic hotels better than timeshare, Carboncitos has best french toast in town! . Staff is best of the best- very good english speaking skills and very willing to help. Very festive and peaceful people , Very safe

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and Very good Location.”
Reviews.Author: garbuttr
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers clean and comfortable rooms. But most of all the service by the staff is unquestionable the best I have ever encountered in my many years of traveling throughout Mexico. I recommend Henry the concierge for any questions you may have. He is a trouper and is always ready and willing to help with a smile.This was my second visit to Hotel Cielo..."the first time I went with my wife who enjoyed her stay as well". I am now classifying Hotel Cielo my home away from home when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: diver123alberta
Reviews.Content: This is the best little hotel on 5th Ave strip. I have stayed there a couple of times these last 6 months and had a great trip. Henry is so helpfull for anything you want or need and will make it happen if it is possible. Rooms are very clean and staff is great, the resturant down stairs is one of the best places to eat. I know that I would not stay anywhere else when I go down. Please contact me if you need any other info about this hot spot...Good luck and Enjoy your stay.... Alberta Canada

Reviews.Title: “Quiet boutique hotel despite right in the middle of action!”
Reviews.Author: juandpurple
Reviews.Content: We saw Hotel Cielo's good reviews in Tripadvisor and decided to check it out when we arrived in Playa. The rooms were not as pretty as the photos in their website (most hotels aren't) but were still very nice! The location is fantastic and is a stone's throw to both the ADO station and the collectivo to Tulum. The receptionists are always very helpful and will answer all our questions with a smile. The WIFI access in room is fantastic!!!! There are a few minus points that weren't a big issue to us but I'll list them out in case it matters for others. 1) The mattress isn't great! You can feel the springs when sitting or lying down on the bed! My mum felt sore back the next morning...2) There seems to be constant perfume release in our room, which we didn't like, and all our clothes ended up with the smell at the end of our stay....3) The breakfast included was very very basic and not the best breakfast we've had during our trip. Overall still a very positive experience and for the price & location we consider the place to be good value. :-)

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay. We got married there.”
Reviews.Author: julijaSlovenia
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend Hotel Cielo. It is one of the best kept secrets of Playa del Carmen. It is clean; stuff is very friendly, food is great ... If you wanna feel like at home while traveling abroad choose Cielo. We got much more that money can buy . We decided with to get married in Mexico. When we contacted hotel Cielo by e-mail they promised us that they can arrange it. More than happy we made a reservation and came in Mexico. Staff of Hotel Cielo arranged us unforgettable wedding - on the beach at sunset---we got even bouquet for a wedding and cheese cake in their restaurant afterwards. We got a baby boy last year and surly we will return there and show him our beautiful wedding place Julija & Matjaž, Slovenia

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cielo is Clean and Staff is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mikealao
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Cielo during January 2010. The hotel is clean and the staff is excellent. The air conditioning unit was better than the ones I've had in the luxury hotels in Cancun. Hotel Cielo is a lovely boutique hotel. There is a great restaurant downstairs that is part of the hotel. We ate breakfast and dinner outside every day. The staff at Hotel Cielo is the best part. You make your reservation through email, and Henry, the manager, will contact you. From that point Henry will answer any questions that you might have and take care of your needs. Henry is an enigmatic and enthusiastic young man who genuinely cares about his customers. The other staff are also excellent and will answer any questions that you have. We had no problems at all during our stay. If you are a light sleeper you may want to ask for a room that is not likely to have other guests going past it. Another warning, your room will be very clean, but don't expect unnecessary amenities such as hairdryers, irons, flat screen TV (although there is a small TV with satellite), etc. Lastly, the website advertises the rooftop lounge, but this is in fact closed - if you want a patio or any sort of view out to the street or ocean, make sure you ask for it when making your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cielo-The only place to stay in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: jandNewYork
Reviews.Content: Great location, near everything – restaurants, beach, nightlife etc, yet secluded enough so that you aren’t interrupted by the hustle and bustle. Service was excellent – Henry (the manager) is huge asset to the business, he is a considerate, meticulous, courteous & knowledgeable professional. When we wanted to change rooms (for a bigger one) he & the staff accommodated us without hesitation. Well organized – clean – professional service – great location – quiet – rooftop relaxation area – friendly staff…..everything you need for a hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very friendly stuff and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AnaHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Cielo only one night. The location is perfect. It is next to the 5th Avenue, the busiest street in Playa del Carmen, but you cannot hear the noise from the bedroom (at least from ours). Henry, at the reception, is a very friendly and helpfull person. The room had a good size, the decoration was very mexican and very nice. From our room we could see the sea and the island of Cozumel in the background. It also has a terrasse from where you have excellent views of the Caribean Sea. The breakfast was included. I had the huevos rancheros and I really liked them. The coffee was awful, but the rest was good. I would definitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great short stay option in Playa off 5th Ave and near beach”
Reviews.Author: Merkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cielo for only 2 nights between Christmas and New Year. Our room, on the 1st floor and facing the front of the hotel, was very big, spacious and clean. We had two balconies and the only negative point about our particular room was that the bar a few doors down pumped up their music very loudly from around 7pm but by about 1am, the area was considerably a lot quieter - so much so that turning on the fan or the AC drowned out enough of the noise for us to fall asleep with no disturbance. Hotel Cielo is a short walk to the ADO bus station but we had a rental car, and despite the hotel not having their own parking, we still found parking for a reasonable price a couple of blocks away. The hotel's proximity to 5th Avenue and the beach put everything we wanted at our doorstep and the hotel suited independent travelers like us just perfectly. I think if we were expecting a resort type hotel, we would have been very disappointed but Hotel Cielo met all of our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff set Hotel Cielo apart”
Reviews.Author: arbowen
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend staying at Hotel Cielo. My girlfriend and I stayed in room 11 (with the balcony) and we loved every minute of it. Take advantage of Henry's knowledge of the town and I promise you will find tremendous places to eat for half the price of what you will pay at a restaurant on 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Nomirena
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really liked this hotel. Day 3 of our trip in Mexico, we found ourselves in a town we didn't want to be in and wanted to get to Playa earlier than we'd planned, so we called Henry and he was able to move up our reservation and give us a balcony room. It was a little noisy overlooking the street, but we had the fan on, which blocked it out enough for good sleep in the huge bed. The room was sunny and clean, spacious and comfortable. And the breakfast at the hotel restaurant was tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: TorontoFatcat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Cielo recently by myself to do some diving in Playa Del Carmen. It's low season so I didn't bother with reservations. I just walked up the 5'th ave from the bus station and went to the first Hotel on my list of possibles. I was offered a room with a double bed on the second floor. Tv, air con, ceiling fan, wireless internet access from my room and breakfast for $33 or 429 pesos. Surprisingly quiet since it is on 4'th st just steps from the main drag, 5'th ave. Breakfast was a limited choice but good enough for me. i usually had mexican style eggs with beans and toast. Very friendly staff The restaurant, Carboncitos, gets a lot of good reviews which I don't agree with. It is adequate but nothing more. Really good mexican food can be had on 30'th ave' about a 10-15 minute walk from 5'th. El Fogon and La Pesca in particular. Carboncitos has a good location and okay food and prices for 5'th but doesn't compare with 30'th ave restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in Playa”
Reviews.Author: KGE
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 2 night stay at Hotel Cielo in late November '09. Took advantage of a great 2 nights for the price of 1 deal offered by hotel and were able to stay in their King bed room complete with balcony that looked out onto 5th ave and the beach beyond. Room was comfortable and clean, with plenty of room to move around. Drinking water is provided in water coolers on each floor. Given the location, it was expected that it would be noisy, especially with windows open, but things quiet down after 11pm or so, so no big deal. Room includes limited breakfast selection next door at Carboncitos which was pretty good. Options included pancakes, french toast, and eggs cooked a variety of diff ways. Huevos rancheros and huevos mexicano were both very good and filling. Front desk was helpful and friendly. We were able to borrow beach towels, just had to provide a deposit. Internet cafe and telephone is next door and cheap, 5 pesos for 20mins, 15 for the hour IIRC. All computers had skype available as well. Can't beat the location and the price, a comfortable and clean option in the heart of Playa!

Reviews.Title: “The best deal we had for the whole trip”
Reviews.Author: M15T3R
Reviews.Content: In our whole trip, which included Playa, Tulum, Coba, Merida, Valladolid and Izamal. Very nice rooms, great hosts, comfortable beds, excelent price. That's where we are going to be next time we go in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: rikiricard0
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel and we shown to our room, and within a couple minutes we could smell something funky coming from a wardrobe in the room....like someone left their wet shorts in there overnight. I went back to speak to Henry, the front desk rep, and he immediately set us up with another room. The new room was spacious and nicely decorated in a mexican style. Not much of a view from our particular room but that wasn't really a problem. And it is true, the staff here is super firendly and helpful....they gave me plenty of info about things to do, like getting cheap vans to Ixcaret. If you planning on using Playa as your main hub in order to visit other sites (Chichen, Ixcaret, Tulum) via bus, then this Hotel is excellent since it is just a block or two away from the bus station. It is also just two store fronts from the main boulevard in Playa where there is a plethora of stores, hotels, restaurants, and bars. The beach at Playa is really a fisherman's beach and may be good for getting some sun, or drinking at a beachside bar, but not really for swimming. Go to Tulum for that, or other beaches along the Riviera Maya. There is also a internet cafe right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: vdelaossa
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff was just as it was described on trip advisor. Everyone was really friendly and helpful and the restaurant next door that had free breakfast was great. The tacos were the best we had in Playa del Carmen! They even kept our bags for a few hours 2 days later after we had checked out and were heading back to Cancun. Too bad we didn't get one of the nicer rooms but that was just a timing issue with the booking. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service at Cielo”
Reviews.Author: MikeIsh
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cielo is a great value for playa. It is only a block from the beach and is right in the middle of everything. You are no more then 2 blocks from the bus station and the collectivos on 2nd and 20th. Since we took a lot of day trips, being near the collectivos was convienent. The included breakfast at the restraaunt next door was good and included several options. Henry, the manager, is great. The rooms are pretty basic, but clean. Make sure you get a room with a balcony. Cielo is right off 5th street and the view at night is well worth it. Overall I would definitely stay at Cielo again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Cielo hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Meli-melo76
Reviews.Content: We really appreciated the stay at Cielo... All the staff was very nice and helpful, the rooms were clean and colorful. We were tempted first by the rounded room up the stairs, but the many windows are facing the hallway, so less intimacy. The second one we got was perfect. Good restaurant below the hotel. The location is not directly on the beach, but a block away, which is close enough to have a better quality / price value. Nest to 5th Avenue in Playa Del Carmen (very touristic).

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: aimeerose09
Reviews.Content: The location was great, our room was beautiful- top floor with views of the ocean from our balcony. The staff were super friendly. My only complaint- we were in a 4 person room, it had one king bed, one full bed, and one twin bed. The complimentary breakfast however, was only for 2 people! So 2 of us had to pay for breakfast everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in Playa”
Reviews.Author: jmurphyjohnson
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Tripadvisor and were very satisfied with our stay. Traveled with a group of family members who all were pleased with the rooms. Henry, along with the other staff members and Russell, were very helpful with suggestions on where to dine, or head to on the beach. Made arrangements for transportation to the airport for us, and they also offer other tour services. Great place to stay just off the main pedestrian avenue, and just down the street from a great local restaurant, Las Brisas. If you want an inexpensive, well run place to call home while in Playa, Hotel Cielo is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the 2nd time--this time with a group of 10 others. They loved its proximity to the beach and shopping. It's also conveniently located close to the ADO bus station if you have to fly out of Cancun. The adjoining restaurant, Carboncitos, has good food, especially breakfasts. Rooms are spotlessly clean and drinking water is provided in coolers on each floor. Be sure to check out the view from the rooftop. The owners and staff aim to please and met my expectations fully. Thanks to Russel, Jimmy and Henry for their attention to our needs. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Girl trip-hotel was CHEAP, safe, clean, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: celinam
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I are both in our 20s and never been to Mexico- Hotel Cielo was SO easy to find from the ADO bus station, literally 3 blocks away. We were given a cheap rate -$50 cash- and given a room right away. The room was clean, altho no real windows- there was one in the bathroom that didn't open. There was cable TV. The beds were hard, but we didn't mind. We were only staying over 1 night until we headed to Tulum. The next morning we headed to Cozumel- the ferry was not far at all. This is the perfect place to just stay a night or two- cheap but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: Thelma50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cielo for 3 nights and were very pleased. The rooms were quite clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great -- especially the Huevos Mexicanos. The hotel is approximately a block from the beach. The shops near the property were much more reasonably priced than other boutique-type shops closer to the resort area and the shopping was great -- however, we felt almost harrassed by shop workers constantly calling at us to come in and shop. It was a short walk to the ferry dock, so we took the ferry over to Cozumel for the day. We were surrounded by fabulous restaurants and great music. Besides the mariachis, we very much enjoyed the musicians at Karen's Restaurant. Our only disappointment is that the Rooftop Bar was open Thursdays through Sundays -- and since we arrived late Sunday evening and stayed only 3 nights, we basically had approximately 30 minutes up there after our dinner and before they closed on Sunday evening. I definitely recommend the Hotel Cielo and hope to stay there again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: delfina27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cielo for 4 nights and it was great. The location was perfect; many shops and restaurants within walking distance, a 2 minute walk to the beach and a couple of blocks away from the ferry pier. We stayed at the family suite which had a balcony facing 4th with an awesome view of the ocean. Most of the shops and restaurants accross from the hotel closed around 11:00pm or 11:30pm so the noise was not a factor unless you go to bed early, which was not our case. The room was charming, clean and it was comfortable for us five. The front desk staff (Henry and Andrea) always greeted us with a smile and provided a lot of information about the area. The hotel had a minor plumbing issue one morning but the staff was able to accomodate us right away and it did not take long to fix. The downstairs restaurant Carboncitos was very good and the staff was friendly. You can also eat at the hotels terrace, which has a wonderful view. Keep in mind this restaurant only accepts cash no credit cards. We had a wonderful stay and enjoyed everything we did in Playa. We hope to be back again and stay at Hotel Cielo.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, beautiful rooms, a mere stroll from the beach”
Reviews.Author: tallulah91
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay! I am a stickler for clean rooms and linens, and it was definitely up to my standards. The water pressure left something to be desired, but overall, I couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - So charming!”
Reviews.Author: aliblaf
Reviews.Content: This was a great little find. A true gem. My husband and I stayed there for a long weekend. We had a great little room that was simple, understated and simply charming. The restaurant downstairs was a great way to start the morning. Loved. Loved. Loved this place. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, clean, staff was very helpfull. We stayed at the hotel the first week of our vacation in Mexico. The hotel is very well located near the shopping street in the center. The beach is only a few metres away, walk a little bit further to Fusion (bar restaurant) It's a nice place to hang out on the beach all day :) The hotel had some plumbing problems, but we where not bothered by it at all. We stayed in room 13 the first days, then they moved us to another room (21, a very nice one! with a balcony, ask for this room if you don't mind the music in the evening) The seccond week we did a tour by car; valladolid, Merida, Campechi (very nice!) We asked if we could come back at the hotel after this week, and was no trouble at all. Breakfast is simple but nice, try the buffet in the restaurant nearby if you want a change or if you want to leave early in the morning. (breakfast at the hotel starts at nine) Cozumel is worth a visit, as is Tulum (renting a car is cheap) We had a super time in Playa del Carmen, lots of shops, restaurants and bars!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hacienda”
Reviews.Author: MX_Beach_Lover_KC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple we were travelling with, stayed at the Hotel Cielo for the first three nights of our Playa trip. I had booked both rooms online, and when we arrived, we were greeted with an upgraded room. I had asked for two rooms with balconies, and my husband and I were given a balcony room with a king bed and two twin beds. Although we did not need the extra beds, the room was nice and large and quite enjoyable! We overlooked calle 4 and enjoyed watching the parade of people along Quinta, while not being directly above on Quinta. We also had a view of the ocean from our balcony, which was a wonderful treat! The free breakfast at Carboncito's was limited, but enough to get you started for the day. What we truly enjoyed was watching an orange juice vendor cycle his way up 4th, set up his cart, and start squeezing his oranges. The juice was wonderful! Once he sold out for the day, usually by 10 a m, then he would cycle off for the day. We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Cielo, although I am a light sleeper, and did have to run the air conditioning at night to block out most of the street noise. This would not be a problem if you are in a room further back in the hotel without the balcony. The small garden just inside the entrance is lovely, and the rooftop bar is not to be missed, at least for the views. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for my purposes”
Reviews.Author: evening
Reviews.Content: All I wanted was a quiet, moderate priced hotel near the bus station for 1 night after a week in Xcalak to be positioned near the airport for an early-ish flight back home. The Hotel Cielo was perfect for my needs, and I would definitely stay there again. My priority for hotels of this type is simple - clean, quiet and most importantly - a quiet air conditioning unit! The Hotel Cielo delivered. My standard inside room didnt have much of an exterior window, but it was fine for a night. Completely quiet. I met the people down the hall with the rooms facing the street - they were huge with a king and 2 double beds. I also had the best towels and sheets for my entire 11 night stay. The pillows were a little hard, but I didnt ask about getting a soft one, since I carry my own tiny down travel pillow. The staff were wonderful! Any encounter was friendly and authentic. While I didnt eat in the hotel (and had to leave before breakfast), I did have a drink on the roof with the guys from Carbonitos - very friendly. And, because they dont distribute Negra Modelo in Xcalak, it was great to have a dark beer on the roof with that view! The deposit for the safe was $50, but it was tiny, so I'm glad I opted to just lock my valuables in my bag. For 1/2 a day it was no big deal to walk around with my money belt - and I always carry the camera gear around anyway.... The location is perfect. 2 minute walk from the bus station, 2 minutes to the beach, where there are a variety of beach clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean. Recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Oxys
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Playa late at 2 a.m. on 18th January. The room was smelly due to some problems with the WC sink. So I complained with the receptionist (Henry) and I had to move to the only room available, a small one on the ground floor. Henry apologized and promised he would solve the problem on the next day. And actually I got a free upgrade to a very nice suite (!) The hotel is in the very centre of Playa, 10 meters from the main pedestrian area. It is clean and nice and the breakfast is very good as well. The staff is very kind and especially Henry is extraordinary. I strongly recommend it. The free Wi-Fi access from the rooms is very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel - Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: jermjerm
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at this hotel on-line for my husband and myself and another couple. I am always nervous booking something we haven't seen in person first, but was pleasantly surprised! We stayed at the Marriott in Cancun for a half of week and then Hotel Cielo for the other half of week. While it was no Marriott I have to say because of the staff, clean rooms and location we all enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Cielo probably even more. The French Toast which is included with the room rate in the morning was to die for. We also had drinks which were served with chips and salsa the first night and dinner the second night at the restaurant below. Don't leave without trying the pumpkin salsa (we tried getting Russell to ship some to us, lol) and the shrimp brochette(sp?) was delicious! Thanks to all of the staff for making our stay so enjoyable!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: rpacheco00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cielo for 5 days and found this to be a nice hotel, nothing fancy but well worth the money. The hotel is within walking distance of just about everything. The staff very friendly and goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable. We were looking for a place to eat and Henry suggested a restaurant that locals like to go away from the 5th Ave. tourist area. Not only did we pay half of what we would have paid on 5th Ave. but we also got an authentic Mexican meal. We will definitely come back to Hotel Cielo

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutiquey Hotel, wonderful staff, Yummy food !”
Reviews.Author: wilbur68
Reviews.Content: As a regular traveler to mexico , i love to stay at small hotels with character - friendly staff - great location - inexpensive. Hotel Cielo filled all of those (wants) and more. Ive stayed at hotel Cielo on 4 different occasions over the past few years and have been (very) satisfied to say the least....Staff is great, the rooms are very neat.... beds are comfy enough, turndown service every morning , very cool Banos. Location is ideal.... Centrally located in the heart of playa, 1 block from beach, which can be viewed from either the beautiful rooftop Bar or the cafe at street level which has GREAT food, spectacular French pressed coffee and my favorite, Icy cold mugs that i like to fill with.... Negro Modelo.... yum ! As for the noise that i keep hearing about.... It is not that bad ! Your in Playa Del Carmen !!! this is not a sleepy little village... its a Fun - Lively - Town where people come to dance-eat-swim-dive-sightsee.... To live !!! For those who want or need internet there is an internet cafe right next door ; ) Want a great massage on the roof or in your room, call Giorgio ! Ask at the front desk and they will happily set it up for you as well as just about anything else..... Very Helpful ! Liked best - Character of hotel, food-drink-staff : ) Liked least - No room service, but thats just my prissy side complaining ;v) Have a great stay Love n Soul ; )

Reviews.Title: “Great value!!”
Reviews.Author: Wingit_SATX
Reviews.Content: We had room 23 and the entire stay was very enjoyable. It was so centrally located and walking distance to just about everything we were interested in. The breakfast was very good and filling enough! I just wished they started serving a little earlier, maybe by 8am instead of 9am. The sink is kind of weird and we did hit our heads but it wasn't a big deal. The bed was comfy enough, but it's not a 5 star hotel. It was clean though, very clean! I'm allergic to dust & dust mites and can tell it was cleaned thoroughly, especially since i'd walk around barefooted and didn't feel any dirt on my feet. It's a bargain for sure and quite pretty in my opinion. We loved the view up on top but didn't notice if and when their bar was open. Our room didn't have a nice view but I didn't care about that and the noise levels outside didn't bother me one bit. Henry was generous enough to hold our luggage after we checked out since we were hanging out in the area until we met up with friends later in the evening. There is a conveniently located internet cafe next door!

Reviews.Title: “Best location, best staff”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaTwilly
Reviews.Content: If you need a place convenient to the bus station for exploring the area, this is your place. The staff couldn't be more helpful or friendly. The restaurant in the hotel had very excellent food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Beach Getaway”
Reviews.Author: msugarcubed
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to playa, for that fact my first trip to Mexico. I had arranged a transfer from the airport to the hotel. I was worried because my plane was late & I was hoping they would wait for me. While in florida, I called the U.S. (718) number for the hotel and the front desk assured me that the transportation would wait. Sure enough, Once I exited the airport there was the driver holding up a card with my name on it. Upon arrival at Playa, the hotel was very easy to find. I was promptly shown to my room; changed, showered and went to the restaurant for a bite and a big margarita. The room that I was given, room 12, was a bright room with 3 or 4 windows that faced the central outdoor hallway of the building.The room was very comfortable with a nice firm matress. The bathroom was small but more than adequet with nice tile & stone work in the shower. The room was clean with an A/C & ceiling fan. The sink that was placed in the room was a bit ackward though because it was set far back against the wall and it was a bit hard to shave but I just attribute this to the quaintness & charm of the hotel. I found the staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful. There was no communication problem with the front desk staff except for the overnight person who didnt quite understand me when I wanted to check out the night before I left since I had an early morning flight. I decided to wait till the morning, we settled up and everything was fine. The ammenities of the hotel consist of a wonderful garden rooftop lounge. Since I was travelling alone, I found this roof top a tranquil escape from the busy 5th ave where I could sit and take in the sunset, have a drink and read a book. The restaurant 'carboncitos' was very tasty, authentic mexican fare. In fact I heard many people that came to eat there raving about the food. I didnt know how good it was so I had no expectations & was pleasantly surprised. It was a bit off 5th ave enough not to be noisy while taking in the sights of the people walking up and down that very busy street. I ate there once for dinner and once or twice for lunch. The salsa sampler platter was amazing. Ive never had pumpkin salsa which was very delicate, especially compared to the other salsas on the plate. My favorite was the salsa verde and the darker red smokey salsa, of which I forget the name. I found the waitstaff very capable, one of the waiters seemed a bit shy when it came to speaking english but still very attentive. And yes there was a patrons' sink which is just outside of the bathroom - Have no idea how that one reviewer could miss it? All in all I had a great stay. The rooms were clean, quaint and comfortable. This is not a luxury hotel, thats not what I was looking for and the hotel management doesnt try to be anything more than what they are. Just a great local place to enjoy Playa. I will definately be back

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - I'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: GSKorelys
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Hotel Cielo for three nights during our trip to Playa. EVERYONE at the hotel, from the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff to the restaurant staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Henry at the front desk even helped me with my terrible Spanish! The Hotel Cielo is not a super-fancy place, but the rooms are clean, comfortable, and VERY cute. They are air-conditioned and everything works as it should. The breakfast that's offered with the room rate is excellent, and we ate on the rooftop one night for dinner - it was wonderful! If you're a traveler on a bit of a budget, Hotel Cielo is the perfect place. It's sixty seconds to walk to a gorgeous beach and there are a ton of restaurants and shops to browse up and down fifth avenue. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a home base in Playa!!”
Reviews.Author: rgould310
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked Hotel Cielo for a quick 3 night escape of the Boston winter. The hotel was in the most perfect location to explore Playa del Carmen as well as the Yucatcan. We were given the deluxe room for 105/night, which had a balcony that overlooked 5th ave and a partial view of the ocean. I think the number one reason to stay is for the helpful staff, simple rooms, and amazing locations. We also thought that Carboncitos is also the best mexican food in the area. Thanks to everyone at Hotel Cielo and we will be back hopefully for an extended stay next year. One note: bring your own shampoo as it is not provided.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel but Henry was great..”
Reviews.Author: pulutan
Reviews.Content: Checked in Feb 23 and was given room number 13. This room was really small and the bed barely fit me and my gf. As one reviewer pointed out the sink was positioned in a weird way, making you hit your head whenever you attempted to wash your face. I also noticed a few bed bug bites when I got up in the morning. It was really weird since we booked weeks in advance and they gave us this crappy room. When we complained to Henry in te front desk he immediately took action. He transferred us to room #18 which had a king bed and 2 single beds, more than enough for me and my gf. A/c was good for both rooms. Roon 18 was amazing since it faces the street and has a partial view of the ocean. Breakfast was wonderful although adding more choices would be helpful. I regret booking in advance since i overheard people checking in with no reservations getting a better deal than what I paid for. Anyways, great staff! Definitely would stay here again if given a better deal on the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, convenient, exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: Imadrone
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Cielo to be perfect for the 1st four nights of our trip with friends to Playa, prior to traveling on the Cozumel via ferry. The location is close to the ferry and the heart of Avenida 5, and 2 blocks form the beach. Henry, the manager, is extraordinarily friendly and helpful, and the free breakfast in the attached restaurant was an added bonus. Do consider taking the bus from the Cancun airport---cheap, clean, comfortable, and the Playa bus station is only 3 blocks from Cielo ---and always pay in pesos if possible to maximize the advantage of the favorable exchange rate. Also, if going to Akumal or Tulum for a day trip, consider using a "collectivo" van. Very cheap, more convenient, and faster than bus or taxi. Just ask Henry. Cielo is not opulent or luxurious, but is neat, clean, comfortable, unpretentious, and an excellent value for money spent. Our friends loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “We would return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: sillyamericangirl
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am quite surprised with the last reviews posted on this site. My husband and I stayed in Hotel Cielo for about a week. We had a fantastic time and were very sad to leave. I guess it all comes down to what you are expecting. We did not want to stay in a large resort because we wanted something a little quieter and with a more genuine feel. The hotel was clean, (and I know because I tracked sand in on a daily basis and it was always cleaned up), the staff was super-friendly and the rooftop bar was AMAZING. Our free breakfast was very tasty, as well as the other food offered by the restaurant downstairs. We spent a lot of our time traveling around to visit other sites, and felt that the hotel had a great location for wandering around the town and getting out beyond PDC. Henry, the gentleman who works the front desk, went out of his way to make sure our experience was fantastic and he always greeted us with amazing warmth and a smile. Roberto was also very friendly and helpful and gave us some tips about places to visit around PDC. We miss you guys! Not only is the hotel in a good location, and has very friendly staff, but it was wonderful to come back after traveling around or spending a day at the beach and watch the sunset from the rooftop bar. (With a few cold beers and some salsa and chips, of course.) For us, it's a no-brainer. When we return to Playa, we will be staying at Hotel Cielo.

Reviews.Title: “A definite keeper”
Reviews.Author: Detroit425
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cielo is a wonderful place to stay - friendly and willing to help with whatever you need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us”
Reviews.Author: przyk
Reviews.Content: We wanted a room with 3 beds and Hotel Cielo offered what we were looking for at a reasonable price. The centeral location was also a huge plus for us. The free wireless internet worked well and was great for occasionally keeping in touch with home. From my first e mail inquiring about a reservation thru our entire stay the staff, especially Roberto and Henry were very helpful and friendly. They would even research the internet when we asked a question they could not answer. We were in room 18, a second floor balcony room facing the street. The room was clean and spacious for the 3 of us. The shower was good, although you might have to wait a minute or 2 for the water to warm up. The mattresses were firm. There were a few minor annoyances. The wooden armoire for hanging clothes had an awful musty smell. The smell did not seem to linger on our clothes, so as I said it was a minor annoyance. The room smelled fresh with the a/c on. The colorful curtains that you see in pictures on the internet are the only thing blocking the light. There were no shades, so it was bright in the morning. We got used to it but it might be tough for some people. I can't speak to the brightness of other rooms. I think some may only have windows to the courtyard, which would be darker and quieter. We encluntered the street noise discussed in some previous reviews. Between about 11 and 11:30 pm the street quiets down, but that's when the garbage and perhaps some delivery trucks show up. The first night was rough, but we got used to it and all the positives of the hotel much outweighed the minor annoyances. They have a water cooler by the front desk. So, either bring bottles form home or buy your first bottle and save it to refill. The breakfast was really good. A potential problem for some is that breakfast does not start until 9:00. They serve until noon. The free breakfast offered limited choices. I thought the French toast was excellent. They also offer pancakes, which are okay and eggs rancheros or Mexicana (hot and hotter). Breakfast inclues coffee or tea. The fresh squeezed orange juice was well worth the extra 25 pesos to us. The hotel offers beach towels free for a $20.00 deposit which is returned when you return the towel. We found the beach north of Avenue Constituyentes much nicer than the beach near the hotel. If you want to just lie in the sun near the hotel I recommend Yan y TAn, which is the beach restaurant directly on the left as you reach the beach from the hotel. They had good, reasonably priced food and drink. An umbrella and 2 chairs rent for 80 pesos. At that point the beach is narrow, rocky and has some seaweed issues. North of Constituyentes (about 19th Ave) the beach is wider and the water seems cleaner with no seaweed or rocks. One day was cloudy so we just threw towels on the sand. The other sunny day we tried to get into Mamita's Beach club, but they had no umbrellas left to rent. The next hotel south is Kool and just south of Kool is a beach area with palapas left over from some business that closed. We took advantage of the free shade and walked next door to Kool for drinks and the bano. We were surrounded by locals and ex pats. If you are wondering if the hotel is safe I can tell you this. The room doors don't lock automatically. You have to push the button on the door knob. Several times we went out and forgot to lock the door. Nothing was ever missing including my son's lap top. I highly recommend the Hotel Cielo. If you have questions about anything feel free to send me a personal message.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: MarlaSOttawa
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for one night at Hotel Cielo last week, and had a mixed experience. We were concerned about bed bugs, as we had read a review early that week that cited this as a problem. Fortunately, we didn't have any issues with this at all, and the place seemed pretty clean. Nor were we bothered by the noise of the restaurant or street, as some others have been. The included breakfast was pretty good, and the location was convenient, in that it is close to the bus station. Our main concern was with our room, which was quite small and very dark...not really comfortable for 2 people. To be honest, this probably would not have been as much of an issue if we had not had the opportunity to see many of the other rooms as we were waiting for ours to be ready. All of the other rooms were were large, bright, and lovely, similar to what is picutred on the website, which made us feel as though we got the short end of the stick, so to speak, especially given that they are all listed at the same price. In addition, when we ask about the possibility of being moved to another room we were told that at least one other larger room had been rented just that day, even though we had booked our room several weeks in advance! That just didn't seem right, and left us with a bad taste in our mouths with regards to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but definitely not fancy”
Reviews.Author: player333
Reviews.Content: Very simple hotel, pretty low on luxury. Water and showers were so-so, toilet was weak, odd sinks that you can hit your head on when leaning down to spit...The door to our room also had a gap on the top so that warm air from outside and mosquitoes could get in - we had to stuff a towel in the gap to prevent this from happening. The room was extremely bare bones and in today's deal world you can probably find a better room for ~$100/night. The front desk also was not very helpful as the person there could not understand English very well and did not make much attempt to help when asked questions. However, the location is great and central, the roof is a cute with a nice view, and the water cooler at the front is key to not getting sick off the water there. Not comfortable hotel but convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I, along with my sister and her husband, were planning a trip to Playa del Carmen for a little winter get-away. I read about the Hotel Cielo on TripAdvisor and was impressed by all the great reviews it received. They are all well deserved. We booked two rooms, each with a balcony. We arrived in the evening and were greeted by the desk staff (there's 24 hour staffing) and checked into our rooms. They were everything we expected: Large and roomy, nice balconies overlooking Calle 4 with its shops and restaurants, clean, and air-conditioned. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is a block away from the ocean, steps to 5ta Avenida, with all of its restaurants and shops, and about a 15 minute walk to 30ta Avenida with its non-touristy restaurants (El Fogon!), Walmart, and Mega. Breakfast was included at Carbonocitos restaurant downstairs with coffee/tea and a choice of Mexican style eggs, eggs rancheros, french bread, or pancakes. All were delicious. We enjoyed everything about the Hotel Cielo, but especially the balcony and watching the street action at night and listening to the music from the mariachi bands. As a side note, if you stay at the Cielo and you're a light sleeper, you may not wish to stay in a front bedroom. But, we noticed that the restaurants, shops, and bands really quiet down after 11PM.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel, 1/2 a Block From the Most Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: MARCO_POLO_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on my way to Tulum, Rooms were very nice and the front desk was very helpful in finding me some good restaurants to eat at, Henry at the front desk recommmened La familar ( my favorite), Manny's Beer Garden( best ribs), also there own restaurant which was really good and inexpensive, I did get some bites in the room but this was due to the mosquito's, I bought some mosquito coil's for the room and had no problems after that, also needed them in Tulum since the jungle was at my back door, the manager or owner named Russ was really helpful and introduced me to some of his local friends who showed me the nightlife in Playa, one of his friends named BM was going to Tulum the same day I was going and he gave me a ride there, great people, really appreciated the special attention, thanks for everything. Will be back with my entire family,

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: RockMi
Reviews.Content: I will not stay at this hotel again...it was highly over rated!!! Sheets were never changed...bedspread had a stain in the middle (if you know what I mean). My husband and I kept socks on our feet everynight and our socks turned black from the floors not being cleaned. Room had a musty smell, ceiling fans blades were covered in dust, beds were hard and needed a new frame. Like the other writer I woke up with 3 bites one morning. Load music nightly made it hard to get a good nights rest. Staff was nice. I already made my reservation for next year at another hotel that I viewed while I was in PDC. I will not stay at this hotel nor would I recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, centrally located, friendly”
Reviews.Author: yuioppoiuy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the center of everything. The room was nice, but a bit spartan. My only critical point is that because it is central it is a bit noisy in the room, but usually this gets better by around midnight. All of the staff was helpful, but sometimes a bit slow

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway in Playa”
Reviews.Author: dallastraveler_9
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cielo was a hidden gem! The rooms were quaint and very comfortable. The restaurant at the hotel was amazing! I highly suggest the eggs with habaneros for breakfast. Make sure to go back for dinner too! The service was impeccable and the owner more than accommodating. He gave us great suggestions on where to go during the day. I'd definitely recommend it and stay there again myself!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience, Great Location, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: kw4811
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cielo was a very good experience for us. When we arrived a little before check in time, our room was not ready we were offered another room in which to freshen up and change our clothes. When we did check in our room it was as pictured on the web-site, very clean, colorful and bright. We reserved a refrigerator when we made the reservations, that was brought to our room later in the day. We asked for extra washcloths the first day and every day after the girls left them for us without a reminder. Henry and Roberto at the front desk were always eager to assist us with directions or restaurant ideas. The hotel offered breakfast at the restaurant next door, take advantage of it, the French Toast is awesome. The location of this hotel is a 2 minute walk from the beach, we rented chairs and an umbrella for about 5 dollars a day at the beach at the end of 4th (if facing the ocean on the left) Antonio will bring drinks all day with a smile. You will also find Wal-Mart and Mega only minutes away, we walked a couple of times to pick up forgotten items and quick snack items. There are so many restaurants very nearby also lots of little shops for souvenirs. Inexpensive phone and internet access is located next door, we only used it twice but never seemed to be a wait. We used the ADO bus from the airport and found the hotel very easily. The ferry to Cozumel is minutes away and there is a stand with fresh fruit for about a dollar, amazing mango, pineapple and jicama (put a little lime juice on it). Chichen-Itza is also an amazing day trip, you can buy your tickets at discount at Wal-Mart. Good restaurants - Babe’s Noodles , Karen’s on 5th (great band) , La Pesta on 30th across from Mega for good seafood (very affordable) The hotel in which you stay makes such a big difference between a good vacation and a bad one. The Hotel Cielo made our vacation a great one, we knew when we returned to our room each night that is was going to be clean and cool. The difference between the Cielo and other places we’ve stayed is the personal attention that comes so naturally to the staff. It was a great value with a great location. I should mention one other thing. The restaurant across the street has live (loud) music until 11 PM, you will be able to enjoy it from your room until that time, if you don’t feel like listening to music bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great...”
Reviews.Author: iluvtravel2
