Reviews.Content: Of the 5 hotels my husband and I stayed at, this place was the worst. We stayed here one night before heading over to Cozumel. First of all, I had emailed them a week ahead of time to confirm our reservations and was assured they had us down for one night. When we arrived, the man at the counter looked confused and I was told that they had us down for the previous night and that they had been expecting then. Thankfully I had printed out all of our emails for all the places we were staying and showed him our confirmation and that we did indeed make reservations for this night. He looked confused and wasn't sure what to do but then said our room would be ready in 20 min. Well, we were lucky enough to get room #1, a ground floor room in the back of the hotel right next to the restaurant next door. It was dark and musty and very noisy because when we went in the bathroom, it sounded like our shower went right into the middle of the restaurant. We could hear everything that was going on and hear what the waiters were saying. Needless to say, we were not happy. My husband complained and thankfully there was another room available a couple floors up. At least in that way they were helpful. So we moved to room #16 ( i think) and it was alright for one night, but very loud and noisy from the restaurant next door and the doors and windows were not very soundproof. It was our most dissappointing choice for hotels. And when we checked out, we were told we owed $94, but I had already made a deposit earlier. So thankfully again, I had my paypal receipt to show her that the price should be $18 cheaper. If you stay here, bring all of your paperwork! Overall, we didnt think this hotel was very nice and if we return to Playa, we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, charming and affordable”
Reviews.Author: drmiggy
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel just off the main street (5th) in Playa. We stayed on a Monday night, so the street noise was minimal but I could see how it might be a problem on a noisier night. The accommodations were clean and simple. No fancy extras but the price and location are unbeatable. Henry at the front desk is a really friendly guy. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mzzzzjess
Reviews.Content: Had a really great stay at Hotel Cielo. It is conveniently located near all of the action in Playa, and a block from the beach. The rooms were comfortable--and although we had a few problems with the air conditioning, they were very accomodating and switched us to a bigger room without a problem. The staff --Roberto and Henry--were great. The complimentary breakfast is also a huge plus! make sure you take advantage of it. For the price, you cant beat it. I definitely recommend this place for a group of friends looking to chill out in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable B&B”
Reviews.Author: bk9930
Reviews.Content: Went on a friend's recommendation ... it's a charming B&B, 1 block from the beach and quite reasonable in price. The hotel check-in/front desk is open air --staffed 24 hours. They will take your key when you go out so you don't have to lug it to the beach. Internet/phone service place right next door -- and very cheap to check emails (unfortunately I had to keep in touch with work when I was there...ugh!). The restaurant was delish, they offer free breakfast if you stay in the hotel, but the place doesn't open till 9AM so I had to go across the street to a breakfast buffet that opened at 7 (in order to get in as much beach time as possible!). I'm a vegetarian and I found all of the restaurants I went to in Playa quite accommodating -- but be aware most of the restaurants use pork for flavoring in the beans. It is a bit noisy at night in the area in general, but not so bad after 11PM at the hotel, especially since it is on a side street off of 5th Ave (which is the main drag that stretches parallel to the beach. My room overlooked the front entry/courtyard. I didn't really need the A/C, but the room was equipped with it and also a ceiling fan. I would have liked it if they gave you a bottle of water in the room, since you can't drink the water, but they did have a water cooler downstairs so you could fill your own bottle. Other than towels in the room, you could ask for beach towels. They gave a bar of soap but no other toiletries. It's a tourist area, so there were a number of stores in the area to buy them, though. I was on the second floor, in a room with 2 beds. The upstairs rooms are not good for those with disabilities ... not sure about the downstairs rooms. The staircase doesn't have banisters, but is walled so you could lean. I got a touch of vertigo going up to the roof, though. In total it was great bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!!”
Reviews.Author: sirena3
Reviews.Content: We first saw the Hotel Cielo while spending a day in Playa while on a cruise, and knew we had to come back to stay. We were not disappointed! The hotel is charming and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. Our rooms were cleaned and made up every day. The restaurant downstairs is excellent and the perfect spot to watch the colorful local scene. We highly recommend the delicious salsa sampler! We loved walking around town, and being a block from the beach was amazing. We received a few recommendations from the staff about which beaches to frequent and were very happy at Mamita's and Kool. There is also a great place where you can listen to live music on the beach that is 2 blocks away. The staff was very helpful in setting up a day trip. They were quick in giving us prices and making arrangements without any problems. We loved Tulum and the nearby water park. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!! Clean.”
Reviews.Author: newYorkFrogman
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent time when i stayed at hotel Cielo...The hotels just a block from the beach and the view from the roof is unbelievable...i highly recommend this hotel and the adjoining restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Winning combination of character and location”
Reviews.Author: constant_traveler87
Reviews.Content: This is a very charming boutique hotel. The staff is friendly and efficient. Our room, 23, faced the rear, so there wasn't much of a view, but it was quiet at night. The location was absolutely perfect. It was 2 blocks from the beach and less than a half a block from 5th avenue. The attached restaurant, Carboncitos, was delicious. In fact we ate there 4 times in our 5 days in the Playa area, even eating there while we were not staying at Hotel Cielo. The included breakfast at Carboncitos is delicious, don't miss it. The room was bright with a wall of windows, a comfortable enough queen sized mattress, and a very nice small cute bathroom. This hotel is great for everyone, the budget-minded vacationing college student like myself, and families too I would imagine. Definitely eat dinner on the roof one night. The sound of the ocean was intoxicating.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cielo is great”
Reviews.Author: OzGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cielo over the New Year's break. We had a deluxe room for 5 nights and then a standard room for the 6th night. Definitely go for the deluxe room - it's a bit noisy (being on the street) but much sunnier, more open and it's lovely to have a balcony. The hotel is in a good location - about 2 blocks from the beach. The room prices rise considerably over the Christmas/New Year's period (as with all hotels in the area) but are still good value for money. The hotel is an especially good deal outside of that period. Breakfast is provided by the next-door restaurant but it isn't great and I suggest going elsewhere (there's a bagel place 2 blocks away which is pretty good). All of the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and speak great English. Overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A fun and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjackson33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here and it was perfect for a young couple. The staff especially Henry and Roberto were amazing. They took care of everything you needed from great local restaurants to setting up taxis to the airport. The rooms were very clean and a great price. The rooftop has an awesome sunset view and just a great hang out spot. You are right in the middle of the main strip and a minute walk from the beach. It was a great location and I would go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cielo's a great value”
Reviews.Author: CBESeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cielo and found the staff very friendly and helpful and the hotel itself to have an excellent location and the rooms were great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it All!”
Reviews.Author: kvfr
Reviews.Content: Great staff, Great location, All round great time. Made to feel like we were at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: beautifulmunich
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cielo is a very good value hotel a fews steps away from the main street and beach. We booked a double room which was comfortable and very colourfully decorated with mexican motifs. The shower was nice and had hot water. Wireless internet was available. There is a telephone and internet shop downstairs opposite the lobby. It does not belong to the hotel but it is still convenient to have. There was some street music coming from the main street in the evening. But it stopps at 11:00 pm. I would recommend this hotel any time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel with very friendly front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: PrizmP
Reviews.Content: We took one of the large rooms with a King and two single beds at Cielo and were very pleased for the price. Those room have huge windows and lots of lights which is very nice... unless you wish to sleep late! There is a blacony too in front of the room where you can gaze at the main avenue (Quinta av.) and at the sea also which is located about a hundred and fifty foot from the hotel. Henry at the front desk is very knowledgeable and helpful at giving advice on where to go to avoid the usual tourist traps. Thanks again! One thing though... the great location of this hotel comes at a little price: the noise. In the morning the noise from main street and its tourists and merchants will keep you from sleeping too late. And at night you will hear the action and some music until 11~12PM. For us this really wasn't a problem because we went to bed around 10PM and didn't have any problems falling asleep with a little background music.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View from the Rooftop!!!”
Reviews.Author: GingerG_IAM
Reviews.Content: It's been over a year since I've been there and decided for a second stay here.... SO glad I did! They've spruced the place up a bit -- while I loved it for it's authentic Mexican decor and vibe, they've gone one step further and polished it up. The Rooftop is absolutely awesome - great sunset views and just a great place to lay out and read a book in the middle of the afternoon when no body is up there - you know you're in the middle of the action, but on that rooftop, you have a little piece of solitude above the crowds. The staff is still great! Rooms are still clean! PRICE is still right!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation in hotel Cielo”
Reviews.Author: slava571
Reviews.Content: I came back from Playa del Carmen about a week ago, and I had a wonderful time. I stayed in a very charming hotel Cielo situated in the very heart of Playa del Carmen . It's a lovely hotel with a touch of Mexican flare. The rooms are very cheerfullly decorated with bright and lively colors which adds to the warmth and ambiance of the hotel. Each room is different than the other which makes the whole place unique. The winding picturesque stairs lead you to the very top of the roof which is turned into a stylish lounge with a Japanese garden that gives you a magnificient view of the sandy beach. It's a perfect retreat for honeymooners and romantic souls. The service is great, everybody is so helpful and friendly from the receptionist to the waiters that you feel at home. All in all, Cielo is the hotel that I would definitely recommend to my friends. Sasha

Reviews.Title: “Cielo is the only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lo212
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Playa and I chose Hotel Cielo based on its great location, prices and reviews. My stay here far exceeded my expectations! From check in and even after check out I was very well taken care of. My dive for the day got back much later than I expected but they were happy to let me have a shower even though I had checked out in the morning! The hotel itself is charming, clean and comfortable. And each one of the staff is amazing. Henry can hook you up with whatever your heart desires. Jimmy and Russ are the coolest NYC ex-pats and are often available to share some guac and a chat at the restaurant. But I think one of the best things that happened to me on my stay there was that I was introduced to the most curative masseuse I've ever met-Giorgio! Being a desk jockey in my regular life, I have horrible back and shoulder pain. Jimmy suggested a session with Giorgio and he actually fixed my back up! Massages I usually get feel good until I leave the table but Giorgio really loosened up the knots in my muscles. He will come to the hotel and you can get your massage on the rooftop with a gorgeous view of the ocean. Sigh. I would go back to Playa just for that experience again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Cielo”
Reviews.Author: DiverBrad
Reviews.Content: You begin the process of staying at this nice hotel by communicating with Henry via the website. He sent us directions on how to get there from Tulum which were right on. Even though this is on a pedestrian street right off of 5th Ave. you can drive your car right up to the door to drop off luggage. Long term parking was about a block away, but if you are just heading to Playa you do not need a car. We had room 27 which had 3 beds, so it was fine for me and my daughter for a couple of days. We had a great balcony overlooking the street. The staff was very very nice and all in all we feel we made a great choice. One night we ate at Yaxche, a Mayan restaurant about 5 minutes away. Awesome! We also caught the ferry over to Cozumel to go diving for a day. I would not go to Cozumel unless you are diving or staying for a couple of days... it was very 'cruise-shippy' and there really wasn't anything there you couldn't find in Playa. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cielo!!! tell your friends and family....I'm telling mine!!”
Reviews.Author: Louie812
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin to express what a great experience it was staying at this hotel. Never being to Playa De Carmen before....I thought it was going to be an adventure just getting there, but I couldn't have been more wrong. A short bus ride from Cancun for just $8 and the hotel is literally 1 block away. Convenience & Service, Service, Service!! The friendly staff is more than "just doing their job" when answering questions about the area and directing you where you want to go.....what to look for....and what to look out for. Truly, making you feel at home. Special thanks to Russ and Jimmy for making me get the most out of my stay. The only thing I regret, is that I did not have more time to spend there. The outside seating at the Hotel Restaurant is such a relaxing experience...with great food to go with it--especially the breakfast special French Toast and Pancakes. The room we had gave us an awesome view of the ocean from 1 of our 2 balconies. The picture painted wall above our bed gave a great ambiance to the room as well, with the sounds of the street level shops bustling into the evening with Spanish background music to go with it. Oh yeah!! you "don't" need a car!! You can walk to anywhere you want to go. Shopping, Restaurants, Beach, Lounges, Clubs, and Hagen Das on the corner. I don't know when, but I will definitely be visiting Hotel Cielo some time in the near future!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place in downtown PDC”
Reviews.Author: BroncoBill
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the Hotel Cielo, I knew I had made a good choice. I was greeted on arrival by Henry who had confirmed all my reservations and arranged a tour for me. A Trip Advisor luggage tag attracted Russell's attention and he also introduced himself. I had requested a balcony room and was taken to Room 11 by Henry, a larger than expected room overlooking the street. The room was immaculately clean with ample towels and soaps. The king size bed turned out to be extremely comfortable and after a nightcap on the balcony, I slept well. Everything was cleaned and replaced daily. I was out early every morning and did not eat the breakfast included, but a dinner at Carboncita's one night was the best I had in PDC--Tacos Pastor, which didn't disappoint me. There was always someone there to answer a question, or guide you to a location. I had a camera problem the morning of my tour and didn't want to go to Chichen Itza without one. Russell even offered to loan me his, but Henry was able to get it changed to the next day without a problem, 20 minutes before I was supposed to leave. This hotel is in the middle of PDC which allows you to pop in and out during the day without traveling a distance. The entire staff always had a smile and hello, and I was made to feel like a special guest. I would not consider staying anywhere else on my next visit----a perfect little hideaway in the middle of town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Best Service!”
Reviews.Author: TXTulip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Cielo 11/29-12/3. The location of this hotel is just perfect. I stayed in #22 and it was just adorable! Russell just happened to be there to greet me when I arrived and Roberto took me to my room. It was nice and clean and cleaned every day. I was only able to enjoy breakfast one morning during my stay and had the french toast which was wonderful! A group of people I was meeting in Playa had dinner planned at Carboncitos which is connected to Cielo. Russell and Staff made this one of the most memorable meals ever. They had the rooftop lounge all set up and it was just beautiful. We had seating for 30+ people. Service was just amazing and very organized! This was my first time to Playa alone and I felt very comfortable and safe at Cielo. I have previously eaten at Carboncitos and the food there is awesome! Pumpkin seed salsa is my favorite salsa out of the 4 or so they offer. I had a double bed and it was very comfortalbe. Sheets and pillows were soft and comfy. The towels provided in the room are very large and soft. The AC is on a remote as is the TV. There are some English speaking channels too. This hotel does not provide an in room safe or shampoo, but they do provide soap. I always bring that stuff anyway and I knew not to expect it. One day I needed help getting a taxi and Roberto walked with me to the corner, hailed a taxi and negotiated a VERY good rate for me! I would not hesitate to say at Cielo again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, people, food...made it a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sophbox
Reviews.Content: Let's see...what more could you ask for: • boutique villa...very intimate and has a lot of character • clean, amazing service and located at the heart of the strip • the staff were professional, friendly and informative • the food at the restaurant beside was amazing. Great prices, quantity and quality. • free wi-fi and there's an internet cafe right next door • only a few steps from the water, shops and bars • roof top patio They had everything I was looking for in a great accommodation. I had a great experience. The staff was great and I think they made the experience that much better. I have to say, I would recommend this to anyone. This is my first visit and first accommodation but I think it will be the only place I will stay at whenever I go to Playa Del Carmen from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: gbs1952
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Playa for the first time and had a wonderful time. Hotel Cielo is perfectly located for just about everything and the staff was phenonmenal in meeting our every need. The rooms were clean and well kept and very reasonably priced. Being first time visitors, the tips and travel advice offered by the hotel staff was invaluable and greatly enhanced the quality of our trip. We will definitely return at some point in the future and have mentioned the hotel to all our friends in Boise, Idaho.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Jeanfrancoeur
Reviews.Content: It was a great trip. Very clean , pleasant people and close to the beach and restaurant. We were there for 5 nights and even though it was a little noisy until 23h, we slept very well. For a bed and breakfast it was well above our expectation. We recommand this place with a big smile. If you go ask the staff they were very helpful to answer our questions. Also try there restaurant the food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay”
Reviews.Author: Angelageorgia
Reviews.Content: Fun hotel in the "middle of things." Reasonably priced. Staff very nice and helpful. Room clean but not fancy, funky Mexican decor. Nighttime is noisy if your room is overlooking the street. Convenient to beach, shopping and restaurants. Very difficult to get to in a car. Explicit directions are needed. Even taxi drivers could not find. Great for young people who do not go to bed early. Lots of good energy in the day light hours.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at Playa del Carman”
Reviews.Author: CRTravaler
Reviews.Content: Had been to Playa del Carman previously but stayed away from 5th Avenue on that trip. Decided to be on 5th this year and Hotel Cielo was ideal. Room was nice (front on 2nd floor with balcony) and weekend noise was as expected. Other nights were very quiet. Disappointed that no one affirmed breakfast at restaurant so we ate elsewhere each morning. Also, no hot water during 3 day stay. Met some other people there who had noisy next door people but management moved them around on day two to their satifaction which was nice. Overall, Playa del Carman was not as nice as previous trip in 2000. European flavor appears to have disappeared. Staff was cordid and we enjoyed using our broken Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fairy1978
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Playa alone but left with a new friend at Hotel Cielo. One of the concierges - Roberto - was so incredibly friendly and helpful. He directed me to where the locals eat their tacos and toward a day trip at Tulum and Xel-ha (both of which were fun). Henry was also integral in coordinating my hotel transfer from the airport and my day trip to Xel-ha. The hotel itself is basic but comfortable. There is definitely some Mexican charm to the rooms - a good thing! You are not going to find a telephone in your room, but there is a comfortable bed, hot water, and AC which is awesome on the humid nights. The breakfast in the morning was delicious. The hotel itself is located next door to an Internet cafe, half a block from the bustling downtown pedestrian thoroughfare, and only two blocks from the green ocean. I was very comfortable and safe during my stay. If you are traveling on a budget definitely check the availability here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: lolipop_8
Reviews.Content: Hy this is Loretta from Switzerland We were in Playa del Carmen in Oktober 2008, and we had a great time at Hotel Cielo. There is a terass on top of the hotel with a beatiful view over the sea (and some other not so beatiful roofs of other houses;-)) The ambience is nice and there is also an outdoor toilett on the terass;-)) The rooms are beatiful arranged, big beds, and everything in warm and nice colours. but there are also some little corrections needed, for example the shower could have a stronger jet of water and sometimes warm water was not working, and the rooms smelled a little of humid wood... but the atmosphere is just nice. The Hotel is well placed just a few meters from the beach and la quinta. The emloyees of Hotel Cielo, particularly Hendry, are very kind, friendly and helpful especially if you need help when you want to do some sightseeing or other tours in Yucatan they can give you great advice or are also organizing something if you want. I would realy approve this hotel, also with it's little spots of bother, you will enjoy it, people and the engagement of the employees will guarantee you a spezial trip. You will love it... Hope you have a great time there. Loretta

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: RojEngland
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for Henry, who is excellent in every respect, this hotel wouldn't get the two star rating I have given it. Okay, maybe I was given the worst room in the hotel and other rooms are much better. I don't know, but my room, no.13 (maybe that says it all) was on the stairs leading up to all the other rooms in the hotel. It was very small with just a bed, a wooden chair and a wardrobe that was too small to hang a shirt up. The mattress was cheap and uncomfortable (I know Mexicans prefer hard beds, so do I; this one was just a cheap uncomfortable one) and the bedlinen was threadbare. The ensuite bathroom was tiny and you could barely use the washbasin because of the wooden box holding the taps and pipes above it. The room overlooked the kitchens of the restaurant next door (and was overlooked by other buildings) and the curtains weren't wide enough to cover the window. Most of all, it was a very noisy room, due to its location. Every single guest in the hotel would tramp up the stairs past my room at whatever time of night they chose to, talking, shouting, arguing or singing as they made their way to their own rooms. There is also no common area in the hotel - the rooftop bar and terrace looked like it had been struck by a cruise missile. Obviously some major refurbishment is taking place, but nothing changed there during my stay so you will have to ask when these works are due to be completed. Without somewhere to meet fellow guests (I was a solo traveller) it's just a place where you can sleep, noise permitting, and no more. I ate twice in Carboncitas, the restaurant next door where breakfast is provided, and it was poor. The staff are friendly and Henry is very helpful and knowledgeable about all things to see and do in Playa. He made some great recommendations and did all he could to help when the room I was due to move to from box no. 13 became unavailable, but the bottom line is there are far better places to stay in Playa for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaede2007
Reviews.Content: So for my moms 60th bday, we decided to take a trip together and after a bit of research and reading wonderful reviews on trip advisor, we decided to stay at Hotel Cielo in Playa del Carmen. We flew into Cancun on Nov 1 and after about a 45min bus ride on the ADO bus, conviniently located just a couple blocks from the hotel, arrived safely where we were greeted by Henry with his warm smile and showed to our room on the second floor, which was to be our home away from home for the next 7 nights. The rooms are quite basic and a wise choice for budget concious travellers with beds, tv, a/c, daily housekeeping,basic ammenities so bear in mind-if u are looking for luxury, this may not be the hotel for u. This hotel has a great location. It is a block and a half from the beach, a block from the colorful streets of 5th ave, where u can have margaritas on an open patio, try one of the many different mexican restaurants, listen to mariachi bands playing music, or shop for everything from sunglasses, to postcards to souveniers as a reminder from your holiday. Henry and the front desk staff are very helpful with offering advice on authentic restaurants off the beaten track, giving directions with easy to follow maps and helping out with planning day trips in and around the Mayan Riviera, everything from visiting the ruins of Tulum to sightseeing around Cozumel for the day. Right beside the hotel is a great restaurant called Carbonchitos. The staff are friendly and efficient and we had breakfast included in our hotel package along with probably some of the best coffee ive ever had... So overall, our stay at Hotel Cielo was fantastic, the only thing i would mention are bring toiletries such as soap, shampoo etc as they do not provide in the room. The rooms can sometimes get a bit noisy as it opens onto the main street and the walls arent very thick so if ur a light sleeper u have been told. I would definitely stay here again and recommend all my friends and family to do the same. Happy travels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerIV
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to say thank you to Henry and sorry that we decided not to stay at Hotel Cielo. It looked adequate, but there was not a safe in the room and that it is a must for me! We appreciate the offer to help us find another room but I went to a hotel that I had stayed at many times that I knew had safes in the rooms. Word to you travelers - it is not uncommon for hotels in PDC to have safes in the rooms - no matter you are told. Do not depend on the website - call the hotel and make sure if you would like a private safe in your room. Henry was very professional and offered to assist us in finding other lodging but I already knew of another place. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cigarman25
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent five nights (Oct. 22-27) at Hotel Cielo. Going into our trip we wanted to stay somewhere low key and in a central location. Well, that's exactly what we got. The hotel is very quaint and low key. Very clean and comfortable. Russell and Roberto were great from the get go in making us feel comfortable and giving us information about places to go and things to do since it was out first time down there. The hotel restaurant Carboncitos was fabulous, the food was authentic and very tasty plus the staff was very good. Even if you don't stay here eat at Carboncitos. The location of the hotel was perfect, one block from the beach and just steps from 5th Avenue. We will return for another stay at Hotel Cielo.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: JaneB56
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days in July with my son and his friend. We had stayed in a fancy resort the previous 3 days. I preferred Hotel Cielo. It was charming, authentic...nothing phony about it. Not luxurious but comfortable. Next door, the connected restaurant, Carboncitas, offered a fine breakfast as well as a great lunch and dinner. The highlight was the chips & salsa variety dish, which Russell ( the American owner, with a Mexican partner? not sure about that ) recommended. Guess what the mild sauce is made of? It's a surprise...a good one! Also, regarding the personal service often mentioned about this hotel: I accidentally left a blouse in my room and Russell had it returned to me, via a regular American guest who brought it back to the States to go through our mail system. Above and beyond!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Shopper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Playa del Carmen for 6 nights. We stayed at the Blue Parrott the first three and hotel Cielo the second three. Being a veteran of the hotel industry for over 18 years, I can tell you there was zero difference between the trendy boutique hotel and the Cielo. Service was prompt and friendly, room was clean and comfortable, and the rate was fair. The only two items that I noticed were a significant amount of employee traffic to the roof top bar which was closed during our visit and there was one light in our room that didn’t seem to be connected to any of the light switches. We had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “A solid friend in Cielo”
Reviews.Author: DiDiMau
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at Hotel Cielo for 3-nights mid-August for a last-minute birthday trip. It is a traveler’s hotel for people who want a base from which to explore the town, rather than luxuriate in their room. The location (on Calle 4 just off 5th Ave) and front desk person Henry are its greatest selling points, along with a footwash (for removing sand), included breakfast, a/c, and free wireless internet (no telephones). Bring your own shampoo. It was crazy hot in August so I barely noticed that the shower heated slower than I am accustomed to. We had breakfast outside at Carboncitos so that we could glimpse the Caribbean sea a block away. Beautiful! What a great way to start the day. Check out the roof view as well. The staff is very friendly and responsive - they replaced a failing showerhead immediately, and kept our keys for us so we could run down to the beach without cares in the world. We peppered Henry with question about town, whale-sharks, whatever, and he was patient and gracious with his time. Thank you, Henry & Hotel Cielo.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BonitaLanita
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed at Hotel Cielo for 4 nights the first week of September. We had a great experience with not a single complaint. I requested a room with a balcony and we got a great room at an awesome value. The balcony overlooked the popular 5th Avenue and had a view of the ocean which was basically across the street. And even better, cars are not allowed on 5th Avenue - only foot traffic so it was nice. The room was nicely done and we asked for a refrigerator which they gladly arranged to put in our room so we could have cold drinks and food. The staff was great and our stay even included breakfast which was perfect. I believe you had a choice of pancakes or eggs. Both were yummy. Henry, who works at the front desk was awesome and arranged a trip for us to the ruins of Chichen Itza and a cenote - also at a great value I might add. One recommendation is to not eat at the fancy restaurants on the strip. I personally feel they are overpriced and not that great. But do ask Henry to recommend some places that the locals eat at. He recommended 2 restaurants to us which were absolutely perfect. I think my boyfriend and I ate like royalty for about $20. It was delicious. I totally recommend staying at Hotel Cielo.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: snapofish
Reviews.Content: The location is simply perfect. It's only a short walk from the ADO bus terminal where the buses to and from the airport stop. The beach is just down the road, and it's on a nice little stretch with deck chairs. The rooms are of a good size. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean. It's not exactly luxury but sufficient for a comfortable stay. We had room 16 which was in the inside of the 2nd floor, meaning the windows opened to the corridor. Was a little disappointed at first because I had asked over email for a room facing outside but was later glad because of the noise from the club across the road. We didn't hear it at all from our room but I could imagine the noise getting to you if you had a room facing the street. It was nice to have the free breakfast that lasts till 12pm, although there wasn't much variety so if you are staying for a long period, it can get a little tired. Still, it's free so there is very little cause for complaint. Variety would have made it perfect of course. Overall, this was a great stay and great value for money in Playa. Playa itself is amazing, the beaches are not as beautiful as in Tulum, since there is more development here but the town is really fun. If you have time, take a cab to this amazing restaurant called Alux which is built inside a limestone cave formation. The food is great, the wine selection decent and the service impeccable. There is live music every night from what I'm told.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cielo Rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: bebeboarder
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED this hotel. My friend who lives in Playa Del Carmen recommended it to me. I am so thankful because it made my vacation perfect. The rooms were really well decorated and clean. The staff was amazing, friendly and accomodating. The restaurant I could not give enough praise to. The food was soooo good and very affordable. It's a small, quaint hotel so the manager is able to personally greet and converse with people staying there. And the price is unbeatable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lost_in_oaxaca
Reviews.Content: I don't really know what I can add to what has already been said about this place. The location is as good as you will get in Playa. Roberto and Henry and exceptionally friendly and helpful and always have a smile on their face. The owner Russel is also very friendly. The rooms are very well furnished and modern. Our room was very large and the airconditioning was essential especially during late June. Although just off the main street, the hotel was almost silent and we didn't hear any street noise at all. Before this we had stayed at two other hotels in Playa and they did not compare to Cielo in anyway at all. The first was disgusting at the second had bed bugs. The hotel restaurant is also very good and offered some of the best food that we ate while in Playa del Carmen. If I come back here then I will certainly stay at Cielo!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: dulcealba
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Hotel Cielo and then two nights at the Playacar Palace. Although the Playacar had it's taste of luxury (but truly just a taste), when I go back to Playa del Carmen, I will surely go to Hotel Cielo again. It is quaint and comfortable; the staff was exceptionally courteous; the rooms were clean and basic; and the location was perfect. Save your money for excursions and going out rather than over-the-top trends. The only cons I can think of are that the air conditioner is loud in room 28, and due to it being a smaller hotel, some cab drivers in town and shuttle drivers from Cancun will not know where the place is. So, bring the address along with you. Simply put, loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at Cielo”
Reviews.Author: BostonBirdgirl
Reviews.Content: Henry and the staff at Hotel Cielo, and also the wonderful waiters at Carboncito -- especially Raoul -- made our stay really wonderful. They are kind, knowledgable, and very helpful! The hotel's in a great, central location -- 2 blocks from the beach, close to the bus station, and close to several great places to eat (try Casa del Agua.) The rooms were clean and pretty, with fairly spacious balconies, where you can sit and relax and survey the street. I had no trouble sleeping without ear plugs. There's no room safe, but I left valuables in the room every day without any problem. Breakfast was excellent -- the French toast and pancakes were especially wonderful. The hotel is also right next to a very inexpensive (25 cents for 20 minutes) Internet cafe. Very convenient if you want to check your email early or late. This is an ideal hotel if you're looking for a simple, pleasant room at a very reasonable rate, with a good breakfast included. There are certainly more posh hotels where you can stay, but you'll pay much more for them. Check out the band Green Earth (Tierre Verde) at Ajua, which I believe is right across the street. They're marvelous, and I think they play nearly every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: owen600
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a five night stay in July. The hotel is in a perfect location, right off the main avenue and within a one minute walk to the great beaches. For the price, the hotel had all that one could want. The rooms are small and ours lacked a much needed dresser, but otherwise we had no complaints. Breakfast was included and there was an internet cafe as well as bottled water downstairs. The staff was friendly and very provided great insight as to how to get around town, with many suggestions on where to eat and things to do. The hotel was clean and in a safe location. It is a must to stay in town while in Playa as you are always so close to all the shops and you can avoid the hassle of always taking a cab back to your room if you were to stay at some remote resort.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaK
Reviews.Content: Just a warning--this is going to be a lengthy review, but I think its definitely worth reading, especially if you're detail oriented like I am. My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Cielo from July 4th-11th, we came across the hotel here on TripAdvisor and after reading all the great reviews, we decided to book it. We ended up loving this hotel just like everyone else did. HOTEL- Awesome is really the only way to put it. The hotel staff were really really great. Henry and Roberto were really great. We became good friends with Henry, and actually invited him to come stay visit us in the states. He was extremely helpful in every single way, and he was so nice. He even helped me out when my boyfriend became very sick one night! We got to go out with Henry a couple of the nights too and had alot of fun with him. Russell, the second owner was really nice too and he made sure we were satisfied with everything. The waiters at Carboncita's were all very kind and always had a smile on their faces. The maid's did a really good job cleaning our messy room every day, and it was pleasant to come back from a long day to fresh towels, and made beds every day. We stayed in room 21, which looked over 5th ave and had an ocean view, which was awesome! I loved walking out on the balcony and seeing 5th ave and the beach all right there. I really liked the decor of the room, and the hotel in general. It gave it a very mexican feel, which we both really liked. We had a problem with the hot water one night (to be quite honest...Ive had a hot water problem at every single hotel Ive stayed at, even the top notch ones so this wasn't surpring to me) but my boyfriend told Russell about it and it was fixed very very quickly...whereas at other hotels Ive experienced having to wait days until it was fixed. Some people said the beds were really hard, but I didnt think so. I thought they were good. Some people also said the pillows werent that great, but again I'll have to disagree...I liked them, and my boyfriend can get really picky and he was fine too. The hotel has a very cute boutique style to it...really nice, definitely a great place to stay. LOCATION- The location of this hotel could not be any more perfect. It is in the center of everything (Restaurants, clubs, bars, shops, beach). I read in a review that was recently posted here that it is too noisy and loud...and I have to completely disagree. I stayed in the ocean view room, which overlooked 5th ave and didnt think it was noisy at all. Of course there are bands playing and things like that...but typically people arent holed up in their rooms in the afternoon and evening, they're out shopping or eating dinner or out on a tour. By the time 11 pm rolls around its very very quiet. All of the bars that are still loud are located a few blocks down and you definitely cannot hear them. If you think noise is a problem, just request a room towards the back of the hotel. The beach is incredibly close (way less than half a block even). When Im picking a hotel to stay at for vacation, location is most important to me, so if this is true for you---this hotel is perfect for you. My boyfriend and I like to be in the middle of all the action, and walking distance from everything, and we definitely were. BEACH-- I really liked the beach...I was never there in the early morning, but during the day theres definitely alot of people there. There are plenty of beach chairs that you can sit on (for a small amount of money) Towards 3-6 it gets less crowded (and even so its not insanely crowded like some beachs can get). A few people told me if you take a cab about 10 minutes from 5th avenue there is a beach that is pretty private and really quiet, so if you're into that you can always take a cab there for 5 bucks or so. Bring lots of sunblock if you burn easily, because the Mexican sun has no mercy at all. The other owner of the hotel put it nicely....if you can see the sun, the sun can see you! BARS/CLUBS- They're EVERYWHERE, and they're so much fun. My particular favorite was ULA-GULA...its really hard to miss because its right on the corner of one of the streets and its illuminated in yellow. Roberto and Louis make the most unbelievable and delicious drinks. I live 10 minutes from manhattan, which have great bars...but NOTHING in NYC even compares to this place. Roberto is leaving to live in london in a few days but louis should still be around for a while, so go get some drinks there!! The two bartenders there are young, fun, and outgoing and will make sure you're having a good time. They also have a restaurant upstairs thats fantastic. One block down from Ula-Gula is like a mini upscale cancun, bars and clubs and a bunch of crazy fun there..check out Cocomaya, they have Cabana's on the beach! If you arent into the loud music and crazyness theres plenty of other bars there that are very laid back and much more quiet for you to go to also. RESTAURANTS- Carboncita's is right below Cielo, which is perfect because they have THE best french toast EVER! Im not sure if breakfast is included for everyone, but it was for us...so dont miss out on it, it was really good!! Not only that but they really had some awesome mexican food there. It was better then any place on 5th ave. So if you love some really good mexican, EAT HERE! Henry also suggested we go to El Fogon (alot less touristy then alot of place on 5th) which was really good too..but I still liked Carboncita's better. It is definitely worth trying though. My boyfriend and I ate at many, many different restuarants there. We also really liked Blue Lobster (good italian), an argentinian steak house called Sur, and Ula-Gula. If you love sushi check out SUSHI GINZA...its VERY good (ask henry where its located, he'll help you out). They just opened a week ago and really have awesome sushi and beautiful restaurant! TOURS- Henry booked us a tour with Rio Secreto, and I have to say that this was the most amazing experience ever. Its a tour of the cenotes (caves). This particular cenote was discovered only two years ago and they only started giving tours of it 3 months ago, so its brand new. Its absolutely beautiful. We also did snorkeling, which was good but Ive done better. If you like snorkling go on the ferry (locacted on 5th ave) and take it to cozumel (about a 40 min ferry ride)...they have awesome snorkling there. SHOPPING- There are stores absolutely everywhere...so if you love shopping, bring some extra cash because they have some very very cool stores there with some awesome items! Even if you dont plan on buying anything there, its nice to just walk around and check out the different stores. Lastly, the only suggestion I would make is to put a pool on the rooftop, its really pretty up there! I dont really care about pools when I have the gorgeous beach right in front of me, but some people like to take quick dips...so it would be perfect for that. We will definitely be coming back to Hotel Cielo in December and we cant wait!!! We love Playa and think its perfect in every single way (except maybe the brutal sun in July)...come visit! Rita

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Asked For a Better Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cjones575
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just arrived home late last night ~ exhausted from our 7 day stay in Playa. We ABSOLUTELY loved staying at Hotel Cielo. From the moment we arrived, when Roberto met us at the corner of 4th/10th and helped carry our bags up to our second story room accomodation ~ I knew we had picked a fabuous hotel to stay in. Both my husband and I agree that LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION! You could not ask for anything more. This beautiful hotel could not be more convenient to anything you could possibly be looking for. And beleve me, we asked Henry where to find everything our hearts desired. From Walmart, to a laundrymat, to the best place to go dancing late into the night. The staff at Hotel Cielo was more than happy to tell us where to go, and how to get there. We met Russell on our first night there, when dining at his restaurant Carboncitos (which by the way as the greatest guacamole and limonadas!! The staff is always so helpful and eager to please). We enjoyed their tacos, and mentioned to him that we were vegetarians. A few days later, when we ran into him (which we did all around Playa!! It's such a small community that it's easy to meet up with the folks you've met along your trip/excursions/meetings etc...) Russell recommended a restaurant that had a huge selection of vegetarian plates ~ La Kalaka, which was just a few blocks down from the hotel. What was so cool about the recommendation was we were about to head over to his restaurant for our meal, but he gladly shared his business w/another fellow community business, so that WE could experience something new and delicious. Very cool, and much kudos to him and his integrity. I could write a novel about how much we loved this place ~ just know that staying at Hotel Cielo, you will be taken well care of! The owner and his staff will go out of your way to make your stay comfortable, relaxing, and memorable! ** As for the hard beds... both my husband and I did not find them hard or uncomfortable at all! ( And we stayed in 3 different rooms #22, #25 my favorite, #28) We also had no issues what so ever with the pillows ~ I'm telling you we were soo exhausted from our day's activities that I don't even remember crawling into bed!! We went on vacation to enjoy Playa del Carmen... not stay hours in our rooms, although you could!! ** And a huge thank you to Russell and Henry ~ I had terribly injured my ankle before arriving in Playa, and every night I was given a hefty bag of ice to help with the swelling. And they often inquired about my ankle during our stay. They are truly genuine when they say they care about their guests. Thanks so much Hotel Cielo! Christina and Edward from Chicago =)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at Hotel Cielo”
Reviews.Author: thad75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent two nights at Hotel Cielo. We originally planned to stay at Luna Blue, but they required a 3 night minimum on advance reservations. Rather than gambling that they'd still have availability, we chose Cielo based on the reviews here. Our overall experience was very good. The staff was always available and helpful, particularly Henry and Roberto. They were both genuinely enjoyable guys and were always eager to help. We also met the owner, Russell, and he didn't hesitate to stop and help us figure out plans for the day. We stayed in one of the larger rooms (28) with a King bed and two doubles. There were just two of us, but I believe the only rooms with King beds are the family rooms. Our room is the one in the photos on the hotel's website, and it is positioned upstairs in the front of the hotel with a balcony overlooking 4th street. The room itself was clean and comfortable. The air conditioner is very loud, but it kept the room plenty cool. We did get a good bit of street noise at night, but it wasn't a problem for us. Honestly the noise of the AC came in handy to drown that out when we were ready to sleep. Others may prefer to be in the back of the hotel, where I'm told it's quieter. The only real negatives we experienced in the room were the beds and pillows. As others have written, the beds are pretty hard. We actually found the pillows to be a bigger issue. They're more like lumpy couch cushions than typical sleeping pillows. Fortunately we both brought our own pillows, but we likely would have purchased a couple from Wal-Mart if we hadn't. There are only a couple of other issues that seem worth mentioning. One is that the hotel does not provide beach towels. We were actually misinformed about this by a staff member our first afternoon, and we took some hotel towels to the public beach. When we returned, someone else explained they prefer we not do that. He said they used to provide beach towels but don't any longer. This means you'll need your own towels (Wal-Mart is about an eight block walk) or that you'll want to stick to beach clubs where they're provided (at a price, of course). Second, there are no safes in the rooms. Usually when we went out, I left my laptop and our passports with Roberto or Henry at the front desk. They have a safe there, and though my computer (a macbook) didn't fit in it, they locked it in the cabinet. This was fine with me, though I'm sure some would be less comfortable with it. We found Carboncitos, the restaurant downstairs, to be very good. We ate there both mornings for breakfast (which is included) and loved the french toast. We also had dinner there our last night and really liked the tacos. Of 4-5 places we ate in Playa, Carboncitos was both the cheapest and the best food we had. The pastor is great. We also had drinks from the bar and took them up to our room both nights. The rooftop lounge was closed while we were there (I'm not clear how temporary that is), but we did spend a little time sitting up there the last night. It's a nice little view of the town and Cozumel across the way. Beaches... We spent a couple of hours at the public beach the first day. It was fine, but you definitely have to pay if you want any sort of chairs. The second day we took a cab further north on the beach (which was only about $2 USD) and spent the afternoon at Kool Beach Club (formerly Tukan). We rented a couple of chairs and towels, had a few drinks, and enjoyed the afternoon. The beach was a little nicer there if you're willing to pay for it. I believe the chairs were $7 each and the towels were maybe $5. One other random piece of advice - be sure you bring all the sunblock you think you'll need. We walked to Wal-Mart the first night for a few items, and we found that sunblock was much more expensive than it is in the US. They know who the market is for that there. Thanks to all the folks at Hotel Cielo for a nice stay in Playa. We wouldn't hesitate to stay with you again or recommend you to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: flyingphish
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this place! The rooms were comfortable and for the price, you just can't beat it. Perfect location, in the middle of it all and a block from the beach, but quiet! Slept like a baby! The staff was unbelievably helpful. We went there without knowing how we were going to get to Chichen Itza (a must see!) and the staff was more than happy to book it for us at a huge reduction in cost from what I found online before the trip. Then, being in that vacation state of mind, we missed the tour we booked for Tulum (excellent as well). So sad... but Hotel Cielo saved the day again, at half the cost! Oh, and make sure you go to their restaurant recommendations. Great, REAL, Mexican food. Not to say their own restaurant wasn't great... best tortilla soup I have ever had! We will certainly come back for another stay as soon as possible! I don't know if you could find a more friendly, helpful, beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: hihopes4us
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 4 and enjoyed our stay at Hotel Cielo! The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of everything. Everyone at the hotel is helpful and friendly. Henri, the concierge, has lots of good information and is always willing to answer questions, arrange for transportation, etc. Breakfasts at the restaurant were delicious. We also enjoyed swimming in a cenote, and horseback riding at Rancho Punto Venado, which also offers a lovely beach, buffet, bar, ATV's, and jeeps. (Henri assisted with the reservation.)

Reviews.Title: “Busy, Loud, Central location, management could be better”
Reviews.Author: beigewill
Reviews.Content: The property is central with a great rooftop terrace. Some rooms have balconies from where you can view the action of the very busy '5th Street'. The inclusive breakfast was better than average for most included breakfasts. The street noise is more tolerable for the 18-25 crowd. The bedding and beds could be upgraded to be more comfortable. The beds are doubles, except for the two 'family rooms' which have a king and two doubles. Accordingly, most of the beds are too small for people who want to relax and unwind in a larger bed, but would be ok if you you go to bed drunk... After having booked two rooms for a week and wanting to stay a few more nights, we thought the American owner (from New York) would have given us a room with a king for the same rate as a double room but he would not so we went to Hotel Lunata which is a few steps above in quality and has king size beds. Their breakfast and rooftop terrace are not as good, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Will_this_name_take
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of PDC. The rooms a comfortable and clean. I recommend a room in the back of the hotel to hide from the noise of PDC. Great location for easy access to bus station and ferry to Cozumel. Keep in mind most hotels in PDC do not have parking so off site parking is necessary. There are several parking lots within walking distance to the hotel. I recommend the bus then if you want a car pick it up in PDC will save you a lot of parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Cielo.”
Reviews.Author: jason32835
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cielo is located right in the heart of Playa Del Carmen's restaurant and shopping district. Henry and the rest of the front desk staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is like a piece of history from the region. The tile-work, winding staircases and cozy balconies make it feel like an oasis when you return from a long day of adventuring. We stayed in two rooms, at first I asked Henry for a quiet room and he gave us a room in the back of the hotel. It was quiet, but after I saw the balconies in the front of the hotel, I decided to upgrade. The upgraded room was bigger and I loved standing on the balcony at night and watching the street. I would recommend getting a balcony room if one is available. If you are looking for a quaint hotel in the heart of the action, then the Hotel Cielo is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Cielo”
Reviews.Author: jcmnyc
Reviews.Content: My friends and I arrived in Playa del Carmen on a Tuesday without having booked a hotel reservation anywhere. We decided to take a chance and take a stroll along 5th avenue where we came upon Cielo Hotel. After Henry the concierge gave us a tour and showed us the room, we were all in total agreement and decided to stay the night. What a lovely hotel- beautiful decor, great service, friendly staff, continental breakfast for 2, internet cafe right downstairs...etc. It was only for one night but it was a great experience. My friends and I look forward to heading back to playa del carmen and staying there again. Besides, the owner is from NYC. what can i say, us New yorkers stick together :-) I recommend Cielo to anyone looking for a cozy, safe, comfortable and inexpensive hotel right in the heart of 5th avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, and amazing guacamole…”
Reviews.Author: epicurean_spygirl
Reviews.Content: are the top three things I would rave about after staying at Hotel Cielo for 10 days. The staff (even the cleaning lady) are extremely friendly and always greet everyone with a smile. Henry who works at the front desk is especially helpful and funny. He knows a lot of information about certain tours and can help arrange them for you. He also has great suggestions on where to find tasty Mexican food and seafood that are not overpriced like at some of the other restaurants in the area. The hotel is located in the middle of restaurants, souvenir shops, and stores. The beach is just one block down the street. The ADO bus station is a 10 minute walk away so getting to and from the airport and other places is very convenient. There is also a Walmart (with a bakery!) several blocks away that is within walking distance. Carboncitos, the restaurant downstairs, serves really good tacos, fresh fruit smoothies, and the best guacamole. I tried guacamole from two other restaurants in the area and was greatly disappointed after having it at Carboncitos. Mario was our usual waiter and he is very polite and attentive. Overall, I was satisfied and happy with this hotel. I would return and recommend this place to friends. However, from my perspective, some cons about this hotel might be: - no in-room safety box, mini fridge, or blow dryer - only one small mirror in each room - the bed is kind of small for two people - some rooms have windows facing the walkway so curtains cannot be pulled back to get some sun - drilling/construction noises on some early mornings woke us up

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: crum23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Cielo. The staff was very friendly and offered plenty of advice about things to do in Playa and elsewhere. The hotel itself is small and unassuming and though it sits right off the main drag, it wasn't loud. The area of 5th ave where the hotel is located shuts down earlier than places farther down the strip which allowed us to get some sleep back that our jobs and children had taken away. The rooms were quaint. The window AC unit was old but cold and the bed could of used an upgrade. The free breakfast in the morning from Carboncitos, the hotel's restaurant, was pretty good, offering you a choice of pancakes, french toast, or eggs as well as a good dinner menu at reasonable prices. Try the pastor(seasoned pork), it is the best in Playa. The hotel has a cool roof top lounge that is very relaxing and almost zen-like, not to mention the great view. Overall, we loved it and would definitley stay there again. Playa is a great beach town and the surrounding areas have so much to offer, such as going to see cenotes or to Tulum, with its unique Mayan ruins on the edge of cliffs overlooking white sand beaches and turquoise waters. And there is even more if you venture further inland. A week wasn't enough to do all the things we wanted to do. So we made each day count without trying to cram to much in and plan on going back some day to see the rest. Maybe that time we'll take the kids...or maybe we won't.

Reviews.Title: “Great People Great Food Great Place”
Reviews.Author: luckymarley1
Reviews.Content: Over the past few years we have been lucky enough to meet several people at Hotel Cielo in Playa Del Carmen. It is a small boutique hotel just off the main pedestrain way, 5th Ave. We have stayed at the hotel, had happy hour, lunch, and dinner in the restaurant, and we even held a party on their new rooftop patio overlooking the Carribean Ocean. All experiences turned out magnificently, and we can't wait to go back. The owners and staff couln't be more friendly and helpful, and the tacos are AMAZING! If you are looking for a touch of the culture during your stay in Playa Del Carmen, and you are looking to stay on a budget, check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for visiting Playa and area!”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker062
Reviews.Content: We found out about Hotel Cielo through Trip Advisor and stayed 2 nights last week. We made our reservation ahead of time directly through the hotel with no problems or issues, and our room was large and spacious. The roof top patio offers great views! The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating and the owner had some good suggestions for cenotes and other activities. Breakfast was included at the restaurant downstairs and it was delicious! We did a day trip to Cozumel for snorkeling one day, and the next day walking the beach, swimming, shopping. Playa has become a bustling little city, but we managed to find some good local food north of Avenida 5. Playa is a great place to people watch, shop, swim, and take day trips from, and Hotel Cielo is a perfect base for all of this.

Reviews.Title: “Diving through Hotel Cielo...”
Reviews.Author: cgrace12
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at Hotel Cielo through a Fantasea Dive package with the hotel. Our stay was very pleasant. The diving was fun. PDC is a fun place but is getting costly with the drop of the dollar. The hotel is very cute, and local feeling. The staff is attentive and helpful. Work with Henry if you can (he takes a lot of pride in his customer service). The accommodations are basic and very simple but they get the job done. Updated towels and room safes would be a plus. We still don't know what the green line shuttle is.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SudburySlim
Reviews.Content: This is a good Hotel. Very clean and the staff are helpfull and friendly. It is a small hotel which has been renovated recently. Even though it has been renovated it retains its unique mexican style. The pictures on their wedsite don't do it justice. The location is great, a couple of blocks from the bus terminal, one block from the beach, and just a couple of doors down from the main steet which is full of shops and restaurants. The restaurant staff created one of the most amazing dining experience I have ever had. We asked them to prepare a fresh gropper we had caught the day before while out deep sea fishing. With no more instructions than "please cook this fish for us for dinner" and "surprise us" the staff prepared a delicious three course meal for us from our gropper. Each coarse was a delightfull surprise and absolutely delicious.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: duskydame
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved Hotel Cielo!!! It was a very comfortable stay. I stayed in a beautiful room with a balcony. The day we got there, was the first day they opened up the roof deck. The view of the ocean from the roof is breathtaking. There is a fully equipped bar and beautiful Mexican lanterns to add to the beauty of it all. This is a must stay!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel Cielo”
Reviews.Author: bjolson
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cielo (formerly known as Hotel Santa Barbara) is a quaint hotel (less than 30 rooms), just a block away from the beatiful beach of Playa del Carmen, and just off the main tourist road, 5th Avenue. We had stayed here two years prior, and decided to come back again for our honeymoon. The rooms are clean and nice (kinda basic), and room 28 the family room has an excellent balcony view of the street below and of the ocean. The staff here is wonderful, and very accomodating. Conseirge Henry is very helpful with local information and special services (helped to arrange for flowers prior to our arrival). Our stay included free continental breakfast at Carboncito's (just below our room), which is very nice (eggs, beans and such....not just toast). They originally had plans to put a bar up on their roof, which it seems like they are reconsidering. I hope they do. It's a wonderful rooftop to hang out on for a great view. I would hope they would put chairs and umbrellas up there for thier guests. If they do this, I would have been more likely to order drinks and food at Carboncito's. Overall a great little hotel, with an awesome location and with very friendly staff. THUMBS UP!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Cielo”
Reviews.Author: jdheth
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Cielo. The staff and management went above and beyond to make our stay outstanding. An example of this level of service can be shown by their helpfulness when we brought "home" a fish from a sport fishing excursion; they not only said yes to preparing the fish for us, but blew us out of the water with the meal they prepared. The management and staff team worked together to give us one of the best dinners we have ever had! The uniqueness of each room, flush with local character and colours, are welcoming and comfortable. Having breakfast included in the room rate was also a bonus... their website indicated a "continental" breakfast, we expected cold cereal, muffins or croissants... once again the Hotel Cielo exceeded our expectations.. a hot breakfast that was delicious was what we were served. We highly recommend Hotel Cielo... its location is close to the beach, close to the life of 5th Avenue and the staff and Hotel helped make our vacation a great slipo away from our reality.
